Dolayısıyla beni reddederken ciddi olmadığınız sonucuna varıyorum; reddetme sebebiniz olarak da kibar hanımların adeti olduğu üzere, beni bekleterek aşkımı artırmak istemenizi görüyorum.
es: ––Debe dejar que presuma, mi querida prima, que su rechazó ha sido sólo de boquilla. Las razones que tengo para creerlo, son las siguientes: no creo que mi mano no merezca ser aceptada por usted ni que la posición que le ofrezco deje de ser altamente apetecible. Mi situación en la vida, mi relación con la familia de Bourgh y mi parentesco con usted son circunstancias importantes en mi favor. Considere, además, que a pesar de sus muchos atractivos, no es seguro que reciba otra proposición de matrimonio. Su fortuna es tan escasa que anulará, por desgracia, los efectos de su belleza y buenas cualidades. Así pues, como no puedo deducir de todo esto que haya procedido sinceramente al rechazarme, optaré por atribuirlo a su deseo de acrecentar mi amor con el suspense, de acuerdo con la práctica acostumbrada en las mujeres elegantes.
vi_translation: - My dear, you must allow me to feel gratified that your refusal is merely a matter of course. The reasons for my belief are quite simple. There seems to be no indication that I am unworthy of your acceptance, or that my status is insufficient. My circumstances, my connections with the De Bourgh family, and my relationship with your family are all highly advantageous for me; and you should also consider that although you have many charms, it is not certain that you will receive another proposal. Unfortunately, your dowry is too small for your beauty and other amiable qualities to have much effect. Since I must conclude that you are not serious in rejecting me, I can only believe that you wish for my love to grow deeper in suspense, as is often the way with elegant women.
tr_translation: "Allow me to give myself some credit, dear cousin; your refusal of my offer is merely in words. Here are my reasons for believing so: –It does not seem to me that I am unworthy of you, and the life I offer is quite attractive. My position in life, my connections with the De Bourgh family, our kinship, all these are in my favor; if you think more thoroughly, despite your many charms, it appears you have not received any other marriage proposals so far. Unfortunately, your income is so small that it surely diminishes the effect of your beauty and charming qualities. Therefore, I conclude that you are not serious in rejecting me; as a reason for your refusal, I see that, as is customary for polite ladies, you wish to increase my love by making me wait."
es_translation: ––You must let me presume, my dear cousin, that your rejection has been merely verbal. The reasons I have for believing this are as follows: I do not believe that my hand is unworthy of being accepted by you, nor that the position I offer is anything less than highly desirable. My situation in life, my connection with the Bourgh family, and my kinship with you are important circumstances in my favor. Consider, moreover, that despite your many attractions, it is not certain that you will receive another marriage proposal. Your fortune is so meager that it will unfortunately nullify the effects of your beauty and good qualities. Therefore, as I cannot deduce from all this that you have sincerely rejected me, I will choose to attribute it to your desire to increase my love with suspense, in accordance with the customary practice among elegant women.

en: Mr. Bennet raised his eyes from his book as she entered, and fixed them on her face with a calm unconcern, which was not in the least altered by her communication.
vi: Ông Bennet ngước mắt lên khỏi trang sách khi bà đi vào, nhìn bà chăm chăm điềm tĩnh mà không tỏ vẻ gì quan ngại và càng không thay đổi khi bà nói.
tr: İçeri girerken Mr Bennet gözlerini kitabından kaldırdı ve işittiklerinden hiç etkilenmeyen durgun bir ilgisizlikle karısının yüzüne dikti.
es: Al entrar su mujer, el señor Bennet levantó los ojos del libro y los fijó en su rostro con una calmosa indiferencia que la noticia no alteró en absoluto.
vi_translation: Mr. Bennet looked up from his book when she entered, gazing at her calmly without any sign of concern and without changing his demeanor as she spoke.
tr_translation: As she entered, Mr. Bennet lifted his eyes from his book and fixed them on his wife's face with a calm indifference that was unaffected by what he heard.
es_translation: When his wife entered, Mr. Bennet lifted his eyes from the book and fixed them on her face with a calm indifference that the news did not alter in the slightest.

en: Elizabeth replied that it was.
vi: Elizabeth trả lời rằng đúng:
tr: Elizabeth doğru olduğunu söyledi.
es: Elizabeth dijo que sí.
vi_translation: Elizabeth answered that it was true:
tr_translation: Elizabeth said it was true.
es_translation: Elizabeth said yes.

en: “I found,” said he, “as the time drew near, that I had better not meet Mr. Darcy;—that to be in the same room, the same party with him for so many hours together, might be more than I could bear, and that scenes might arise unpleasant to more than myself.”
vi: - Khi ngày ấy đến gần, tôi nghĩ rằng tôi không nên gặp anh Darcy, rằng hiện diện trong cùng phòng, cùng buổi họp mặt trong nhiều giờ anh là việc tôi không thể chịu được, trong khi những người khác có thể bị khó chịu lây.
tr: "Zaman yaklaştıkça," dedi, "Mr Darcy'yle karşılaşmamanın daha iyi olacağını hissettim; –onunla o kadar saat aynı odada, aynı toplulukta olmak dayanabileceğimden fazla olabilir, benden çok başkalarını rahatsız edebilecek sahneler meydana gelebilirdi.
es: ––Al acercarse el momento ––dijo–– me pareció que haría mejor en no encontrarme con Darcy, pues el estar juntos en un salón durante tantas horas hubiera sido superior a mis fuerzas y la situación podía haberse hecho desagradable, además, a otras personas.
vi_translation: - When that day approached, I thought that I should not meet Mr. Darcy, that being present in the same room, at the same gathering for many hours with him was something I could not endure, while others might also be affected by the discomfort.
tr_translation: "As the time approached," she said, "I felt it would be better not to encounter Mr. Darcy; –being in the same room, in the same company with him for so many hours could be more than I could bear, scenes that could disturb others more than myself might occur."
es_translation: ––As the moment approached ––he said–– it seemed to me that it would be better not to meet Darcy, for being together in a room for so many hours would have been beyond my strength and the situation could have become unpleasant, moreover, for other people.

en: “‘When my brother left us yesterday, he imagined that the business which took him to London might be concluded in three or four days; but as we are certain it cannot be so, and at the same time convinced that when Charles gets to town he will be in no hurry to leave it again, we have determined on following him thither, that he may not be obliged to spend his vacant hours in a comfortless hotel. Many of my acquaintance are already there for the winter: I wish I could hear that you, my dearest friend, had any intention of making one in the crowd, but of that I despair. I sincerely hope your Christmas in Hertfordshire may abound in the gaieties which that season generally brings, and that your beaux will be so numerous as to prevent your feeling the loss of the three of whom we shall deprive you.’
vi: “Khi anh của em ra đi ngày hôm qua, anh ấy nghĩ rằng công việc tại London có thể kết thúc trong vòng ba, bốn ngày, nhưng chúng em không thể tin được, cùng lúc chúng em cho rằng khi Charles đã vào thành phố, anh ấy sẽ không vội rời đi, nên chúng em quyết định đi theo, để anh không phải cô đơn trong căn phòng khách sạn thiếu tiện nghi. Nhiều người quen biết của em đã đến đấy cho mùa đông; em ước mong chị, người bạn thân cận nhất của em, có thể gia nhập đám đông, nhưng em không chắc. Em thành thật chúc chị một mùa Giáng Sinh vui vẻ tại Herfordshire, và chị sẽ có nhiều người theo đuổi để giúp chị quên ba người chúng em.”
tr: " ‘Kardeşim dün bizden ayrılırken Londra'ya gitmesini gerektiren işin üç dört gün içinde halledilebileceğini düşünüyordu; ama şimdi bunun mümkün olmadığını bildiğimiz, aynı zamanda Charles'ın şehre inince dönmek bilmeyeceğine de inandığımız için, boş saatlerini rahatsız bir otelde geçirmek zorunda kalmasın diye arkasından gitmeye karar verdik. Zaten tanıdıklarımın çoğu kış için oraya gelmişler; keşke sen de, sevgili arkadaşım, bize katılmaya niyetlensen –ama bundan umutlu değilim. Bütün içtenliğimle Christmas'ın Hertfordshire'e ve sana her zamanki gibi neşe getirmesini ve hayranlarının seni yoksun bıraktığımız üç arkadaşının kaybını hissetmeni önlemesini dilerim.' "
es: Te lo leeré: «Cuando mi hermano nos dejó ayer, se imaginaba que los asuntos que le llamaban a Londres podrían despacharse en tres o cuatro días; pero como sabemos que no será así y convencidas, al mismo tiempo, de que cuando Charles va a la capital no tiene prisa por volver, hemos determinado irnos con él para que no tenga que pasarse las horas que le quedan libres en un hotel, sin ninguna comodidad. Muchas de nuestras relaciones están ya allí para pasar el invierno; me gustaría saber si usted, queridísima amiga, piensa hacer lo mismo; pero no lo creo posible. Deseo sinceramente que las navidades en Hertfordshire sean pródigas en las alegrías propias de esas festividades, y que sus galanes sean tan numerosos que les impidan sentir la pérdida de los tres caballeros que les arrebatamos.»
vi_translation: "When my brother left yesterday, he thought that the job in London might be finished in three or four days, but we couldn't believe it. At the same time, we thought that once Charles was in the city, he wouldn't be in a hurry to leave, so we decided to follow him, so he wouldn't be alone in the uncomfortable hotel room." "Many of my acquaintances have gone there for the winter; I wish you, my closest friend, could join the crowd, but I'm not sure." "I sincerely wish you a Merry Christmas in Herfordshire, and you will have many suitors to help you forget the three of us."
tr_translation: " ‘My brother, when leaving us yesterday, thought that the business requiring him to go to London could be handled within three or four days; but now that we know this is not possible, and also believing that Charles will not return once he gets to the city, we decided to follow him so that he wouldn't have to spend his idle hours in an uncomfortable hotel. Most of my acquaintances have already come there for the winter; I wish you too, my dear friend, would consider joining us – but I am not hopeful about this. With all my heart, I wish that Christmas brings joy to Hertfordshire and to you as it always does, and that your admirers prevent you from feeling the loss of the three friends we have deprived you of.' "
es_translation: I will read it to you: «When my brother left us yesterday, he imagined that the matters calling him to London could be handled in three or four days; but as we know that this will not be the case and convinced, at the same time, that when Charles goes to the capital he is in no hurry to return, we have decided to go with him so that he does not have to spend his free hours in a hotel, without any comfort. Many of our acquaintances are already there to spend the winter; I would like to know if you, dearest friend, plan to do the same; but I don't think it possible. I sincerely wish that Christmas in Hertfordshire is bountiful in the joys typical of these festivities, and that your suitors are so numerous that they prevent you from feeling the loss of the three gentlemen we are taking away from you.»

en: “It is only evident that Miss Bingley does not mean he should.”
vi: - Em chỉ thấy ý rõ ràng rằng cô Bingley ngụ ý anh ấy không nên trở lại.
tr: "Tek belli olan şu, Miss Bingley döneceğini söylemiyor.
es: ––Lo único que es evidente es que la señorita Bingley es la que dice que él no va a volver.
vi_translation: - I only see a clear intention that Miss Bingley implies he should not return.
tr_translation: "The only certain thing is, Miss Bingley is not saying she will return."
es_translation: ––The only thing that is evident is that Miss Bingley is the one who says he is not coming back.

en: Jane shook her head.
vi: Jane lắc đầu.
tr: Jane başını salladı.
es: Jane lo negó con la cabeza.
vi_translation: Jane shook her head.
tr_translation: Jane nodded her head.
es_translation: Jane shook her head.

en: “How can you talk so?” said Jane, faintly smiling; “you must know, that, though I should be exceedingly grieved at their disapprobation, I could not hesitate.”
vi: Jane cười nhẹ: - Làm thế nào em có thể nói như thế? Em phải biết rằng mặc dù chị có thể rất buồn vì họ không chấp nhận chị, chị không thể lưỡng lự.
tr: "Nasıl böyle konuşabiliyorsun?" dedi Jane, belli belirsiz gülümseyerek. "Biliyorsun ki onlar onaylamazlarsa çok üzülürüm ama bir dakika tereddüt etmem.
es: ––¡Qué cosas tienes! dijo Jane con una leve sonrisa––. Debes saber que aunque me apenaría mucho su desaprobación, no vacilaría.
vi_translation: Jane smiled softly: - How can you say that? You must know that although I might be very sad because they don't accept me, I cannot hesitate.
tr_translation: "How can you talk like that?" said Jane, with a faint smile. "You know that if they don't approve, I would be very upset, but I wouldn't hesitate for a minute."
es_translation: said Jane with a slight smile––. You must know that although their disapproval would sadden me greatly, I would not hesitate.

en: They were all astonished; and Mr. Bennet, who could by no means wish for so speedy a return, immediately said,—
vi: Cả gia đình đều ngạc nhiên. Không hề nghĩ sẽ có câu trả lời nhanh như thế. Ông Bennet nói ngay:
tr: Hepsi şaşırdılar; o kadar hızlı bir dönüş istemeyen Mr Bennet hemen lafa girdi–
es: Todos se quedaron asombrados, y el señor Bennet, que de ningún modo deseaba tan rápido regreso, se apresuró a decir:
vi_translation: The whole family was surprised. They never thought there would be such a quick response. Mr. Bennet immediately said:
tr_translation: They were all surprised; not wanting such a quick turn of events, Mr. Bennet immediately spoke up–
es_translation: Everyone was astonished, and Mr. Bennet, who in no way desired such a quick return, hastened to say:

en: “Believe me, my dear sir, my gratitude is warmly excited by such affectionate attention; and, depend upon it, you will speedily receive from me a letter of thanks for this as well as for every other mark of your regard during my stay in Hertfordshire. As for my fair cousins, though my absence may not be long enough to render it necessary, I shall now take the liberty of wishing them health and happiness, not excepting my cousin Elizabeth.”
vi: - Thưa ông, xin hãy tin tôi, tôi cảm kích nồng hậu về lòng quan tâm đầy tình cảm như thế, và tôi sẽ viết cho ông một thư cảm ơn về lòng quan tâm này, cũng như về những gì tôi nhận được trong thời gian tôi lưu lại tại Hertfordshire. Về phần các cô em họ xinh xắn của tôi, mặc dù tôi sẽ vắng mặt không lâu nên không cần thiết phải chúc tụng nhiều, tôi vẫn xin chúc các cô sức khỏe và hạnh phúc, không ngoại trừ cô Elizabeth.
tr: "İnanın bana, sayın beyefendi, minnettarlığım bu sevecen alakanızla kat kat arttı; bunun için ve Hertfordshire'deki misafirliğim sürecince gösterdiğiniz tüm anlayış için benden hemencecik teşekkür mektubu alacağınıza emin olun. Güzel kuzenlerime gelince, gerçi yokluğum bunu gerekli kılacak kadar uzun sürmez ama, onlara sağlık ve mutluluk dilemek isterim, tabii kuzenim Elizabeth de dahil olmak üzere.
es: ––Créame, mi querido señor, mi gratitud aumenta con sus afectuosos consejos, por lo que le prevengo que en breve recibirá una carta de agradecimiento por lo mismo y por todas las otras pruebas de consideración que usted me ha dado durante mi permanencia en Hertfordshire. En cuanto a mis hermosas primas, aunque mi ausencia no ha de ser tan larga como para que haya necesidad de hacerlo, me tomaré la libertad de desearles salud y felicidad, sin exceptuar a mi prima Elizabeth.
vi_translation: - Sir, please believe me, I am deeply grateful for such heartfelt concern, and I will write you a thank-you letter for this concern, as well as for what I received during my stay in Hertfordshire. As for my lovely cousins, although my absence will not be long and there is no need for many well-wishes, I still wish them health and happiness, including Miss Elizabeth.
tr_translation: "Believe me, dear sir, my gratitude has increased manifold with your kind concern; for this and for all the understanding you have shown during my stay in Hertfordshire, you can be sure that you will receive a thank-you letter from me immediately. As for my lovely cousins, although my absence will not be long enough to necessitate it, I wish them health and happiness, including my cousin Elizabeth."
es_translation: ––Believe me, my dear sir, my gratitude increases with your affectionate advice, so I warn you that you will soon receive a letter of thanks for the same and for all the other proofs of consideration that you have given me during my stay in Hertfordshire. As for my beautiful cousins, although my absence will not be so long as to make it necessary, I will take the liberty of wishing them health and happiness, not excluding my cousin Elizabeth.

en: This was not very consoling to Mrs. Bennet; and, therefore, instead of making any answer, she went on as before.
vi: Việc này không xoa dịu bà Bennet, nên thay vì trả lời, bà vẫn tiếp tục:
tr: Bunlar Mrs Bennet'ı rahatlatmıyordu; o yüzden, cevap vermek yerine, bildiği gibi devam ediyordu.
es: No era muy consolador, que digamos, para la señora Bennet; sin embargó, en vez de contestar, continuó:
vi_translation: This did not appease Mrs. Bennet, so instead of replying, she continued:
tr_translation: These did not comfort Mrs. Bennet; therefore, instead of replying, she continued as she knew best.
es_translation: It was not very comforting, to say the least, for Mrs. Bennet; however, instead of replying, she continued:

en: Elizabeth looked at her sister with incredulous solicitude, but said nothing.
vi: Elizabeth nhìn chị với lòng quan ngại không thể tin nổi, nhưng không nói gì.
tr: Elizabeth kuşkulu bir endişeyle ablasına baktı, ama bir şey demedi.
es: Elizabeth, solícita e incrédula, miró a su hermana, pero no dijo nada.
vi_translation: Elizabeth looked at her sister with incredible concern, but said nothing.
tr_translation: Elizabeth looked at her sister with a suspicious concern, but said nothing.
es_translation: Elizabeth, solicitous and incredulous, looked at her sister, but said nothing.

en: “You doubt me,” cried Jane, slightly colouring; “indeed, you have no reason. He may live in my memory as the most amiable man of my acquaintance but that is all. I have nothing either to hope or fear, and nothing to reproach him with. Thank God I have not that pain. A little time, therefore—I shall certainly try to get the better——”
vi: Jane thốt lên mặt hơi ửng đỏ: - Em nghi ngờ chị; thật ra em không có lý gì gì mà nghi ngờ. Anh ấy có thể ngự trị trong tâm tưởng của chị như là một người dễ thương nhất trong số những người chị quen biết, nhưng chỉ có thế. Chị không có gì để hi vọng hay lo lắng, mà cũng không có gì để phiền trách anh ấy. Lạy ơn chúa! Chị đã không cảm thấy đau khổ như thế. Chỉ một thời gian ngắn thôi, rồi chị sẽ cảm thấy khá hơn.
tr: "Bana inanmıyorsun," diye haykırdı Jane, hafifçe rengi dönerek, "ama inanmaman için neden yok. Tanıdığım en hoş adam olarak anılarımda yaşayabilir, ama hepsi bu. Umut edecek ya da korkacak bir şeyim yok, onu kınamamı gerektirecek bir şey de yok. Çok şükür! Acının o türünü çekmiyorum. Demek ki az bir zaman yetecek. –Elbette düzelmeye çalışacağım.
es: ––¿Lo dudas? ––preguntó Jane ligeramente ruborizada––. No tienes motivos. Le recordaré siempre como el mejor hombre que he conocido, eso es todo. Nada tengo que esperar ni que temer, y nada tengo que reprocharle. Gracias a Dios, no me queda esa pena. Así es que dentro de poco tiempo, estaré mucho mejor.
vi_translation: Jane exclaimed, her face slightly flushed: - I suspect you; in fact, I have no reason to suspect you. He may reign in your thoughts as the most charming person among those you know, but that's all. You have nothing to hope for or worry about, and nothing to blame him for. Thank God! You haven't felt such pain. Just a short time, and you will feel better.
tr_translation: "You don't believe me," cried Jane, her color slightly changing, "but there is no reason for you not to believe. He may live in my memories as the nicest man I have known, but that's all. I have nothing to hope for or fear, and nothing that requires me to condemn him. Thank goodness! I don't suffer that kind of pain. So a little time will be enough. –Of course, I will try to get better."
es_translation: ––Do you doubt it? ––asked Jane, slightly blushing––. You have no reason to. I will always remember him as the best man I have ever known, that's all. I have nothing to hope for nor to fear, and I have nothing to reproach him for. Thank God, I am spared that sorrow. So, in a short time, I will be much better.

en: Miss Bennet eagerly disclaimed all extraordinary merit, and threw back the praise on her sister’s warm affection.
vi: Jane từ chối nhận mọi lời khen tặng và khen tặng ngược lại em gái.
tr: Miss Bennet tüm bu olağanüstü özellikleri ısrarla reddetti ve övgüyü kızkardeşinin sevecenliğine verdi.
es: Jane negó vehementemente que tuviese algún mérito extraordinario y rechazó los elogios de su hermana que eran sólo producto de su gran afecto.
vi_translation: Jane refused to accept any compliments and instead complimented her sister.
tr_translation: Miss Bennet persistently denied all these extraordinary qualities and attributed the praise to her sister's kindness.
es_translation: Jane vehemently denied having any extraordinary merit and rejected her sister's praises, which were only a product of her great affection.

en: “Thank you, sir, but a less agreeable man would satisfy me. We must not all expect Jane’s good fortune.”
vi: - Cảm ơn bố, nhưng một người ít dễ chịu hơn cũng đủ làm con mãn nguyện. Tất cả chúng ta không nên trông chờ vào vận may như Jane.
tr: "Teşekkür ederim, efendim, ama daha az sevimli bir adam bana yeter. Hepimiz Jane kadar talihli olmayı umamayız.
es: ––Gracias, papá, pero me conformaría con un hombre menos agradable. No todos podemos esperar tener tan buena suerte como Jane.
vi_translation: - Thank you, Dad, but a less pleasant person would also make me happy. None of us should rely on luck like Jane.
tr_translation: "Thank you, sir, but a less charming man will suffice for me." "We cannot all hope to be as fortunate as Jane.""
es_translation: ––Thank you, Dad, but I would be satisfied with a less pleasant man. Not all of us can expect to be as lucky as Jane.

en: “An excellent consolation in its way,” said Elizabeth; “but it will not do for us. We do not suffer by accident. It does not often happen that the interference of friends will persuade a young man of independent fortune to think no more of a girl whom he was violently in love with only a few days before.”
vi: Elizabeth nói: - Mợ khéo an ủi lắm, nhưng không giúp gì cho chúng cháu. Chúng cháu không khổ sở do biến cố. Việc những người thân cận can thiệp để thuyết phục một thanh niên có sự sản độc lập quên bẵng một cô gái mà anh đã yêu mãnh liệt chỉ vài ngày trước thì không thường xảy ra.
tr: "Kendi başına mükemmel bir avuntu," dedi Elizabeth, "ama bizim işimize yaramıyor. Tesadüfen acı çekiyor değiliz. Arkadaş müdahalesi kendi geliri olan genç bir adamı daha birkaç gün önce şiddetle âşık olduğu bir kızı unutmaya ikna etsin, asıl bu sık olan bir şey değil.
es: ––Si hubiera sido así, sería un gran consuelo ––dijo Elizabeth––, pero lo nuestro es diferente. Lo que nos ha pasado no ha sido casualidad. No es tan frecuente que unos amigos se interpongan y convenzan a un joven independiente de que deje de pensar en una muchacha de la que estaba locamente enamorado unos días antes.
vi_translation: Elizabeth said: - You are very good at comforting, but it doesn't help us. We are not suffering because of the incident. It is not common for close relatives to intervene to persuade a young man with independent means to completely forget a girl he passionately loved just a few days before.
tr_translation: "A perfect solace on its own," said Elizabeth, "but it doesn't work for us. We are not suffering by chance. That a friend's intervention convinces a young man with his own income to forget a girl he was passionately in love with just a few days ago, this is not something that happens often."
es_translation: ––If that had been the case, it would be a great comfort ––said Elizabeth––, but our situation is different. What happened to us was not by chance. It is not so common for friends to intervene and convince an independent young man to stop thinking about a girl he was madly in love with just a few days before.

en: “But that expression of ‘violently in love’ is so hackneyed, so doubtful, so indefinite, that it gives me very little idea. It is as often applied to feelings which arise only from a half hour’s acquaintance, as to a real, strong attachment. Pray, how violent was Mr. Bingley’s love?”
vi: - Nhưng cách nói “yêu mãnh liệt” thì quá nhảm, quá đáng ngờ, quá mông lung nên không nói gì được nhiều. Nó thường chỉ những tâm tư xuất phát từ những cuộc giao tiếp trong nữa giờ đồng hồ cũng như chỉ tình yêu chân thật. Cháu thử hỏi xem, tình yêu của anh Bingley mãnh liệt như thế nào?
tr: "Ama bu ‘şiddetle âşık olduğu' ifadesi öyle basmakalıp, öyle kuşkulu, öyle belirsiz ki bana pek az fikir veriyor. Yarım saat tanışıklıktan doğan duygulara olduğu kadar gerçek, güçlü bağlılıklara da uyabilir. Lütfen, Mr Bingley'nin aşkı ne kadar şiddetliydi, söyler misin?
es: ––Pero esa expresión, «locamente enamorado», está tan manida, es tan ambigua y tan indefinida, que no me dice nada. Lo mismo se aplica a sentimientos nacidos a la media hora de haberse conocido, que a un cariño fuerte y verdadero. Explícame cómo era el amor del señor Bingley.
vi_translation: - But the phrase "intense love" is too nonsensical, too suspicious, too vague, so there's not much to say about it. It usually refers to emotions stemming from interactions lasting half an hour, as well as true love. Try asking yourself, how intense is Mr. Bingley's love?
tr_translation: "But this expression 'violently in love' is so clichéd, so doubtful, so vague that it gives me very little idea. It can apply to feelings born from half an hour's acquaintance as well as to real, strong attachments. Please, can you tell me how intense Mr. Bingley's love was?"
es_translation: ––But that expression, "madly in love," is so overused, so ambiguous and so vague, that it tells me nothing. The same applies to feelings born half an hour after meeting, as to a strong and true affection. Explain to me what Mr. Bingley's love was like.

en: Elizabeth was exceedingly pleased with this proposal, and felt persuaded of her sister’s ready acquiescence.
vi: Elizabeth rất vui với lời đề nghị như thế, tin chắc chị mình sẽ ung thuận.
tr: Elizabeth bu teklife son derece memnun oldu; ablasının dünden razı olduğuna inandığını söyledi.
es: A Elizabeth le pareció estupenda esta proposición y no dudó de que su hermana la aceptaría.
vi_translation: Elizabeth was very pleased with such a proposal, confident that her sister would agree.
tr_translation: Elizabeth was extremely pleased with the offer; she said she believed her sister was more than willing from the start.
es_translation: Elizabeth found this proposition wonderful and did not doubt that her sister would accept it.

en: “You are too sensible a girl, Lizzy, to fall in love merely because you are warned against it; and, therefore, I am not afraid of speaking openly. Seriously, I would have you be on your guard. Do not involve yourself, or endeavour to involve him, in an affection which the want of fortune would make so very imprudent. I have nothing to say against him: he is a most interesting young man; and if he had the fortune he ought to have, I should think you could not do better. But as it is—you must not let your fancy run away with you. You have sense, and we all expect you to use it. Your father would depend on your resolution and good conduct, I am sure. You must not disappoint your father.”
vi: - Lizzy, cháu đủ chín chắn nên cháu sẽ không yêu đương chỉ vì bị cảnh giác là không nên. Vì thế, mợ sẽ không ngại gì phải nói thẳng. Mợ cần cảnh giác cháu, mợ nói nghiêm túc đấy. Cháu không nên vướng víu với anh ấy trong một cuộc tình mà ham muốn vật chất có thể khiến tình yêu trở nên khinh suất. Mợ không có gì chê bai anh ấy; anh là người đáng cho ta để tâm đến nhất; và nếu anh có tài sản mà anh đáng lẽ được hưởng, mợ có thể nói không có gì hay hơn cho cháu. Cháu có ý thức, và mọi người đều mong cháu vận dụng ý thức. Mợ tin rằng bố cháu sẽ trông cậy nơi tính kiên định và đức hạnh của cháu. Cháu không nên làm bố cháu thất vọng.
tr: "Sen çok aklı başında bir kızsın, Lizzy, sırf ikaz edildiğin için kimseye âşık olmazsın; o yüzden seninle açık konuşmaktan korkmuyorum. Cidden, sana kendini korumanı öneririm. Parasızlığın imkânsız kılacağı bir beraberliğe kendin de girme, onu sokmaya da çalışma. Ona karşı söyleyecek hiçbir şeyim yok; çok ilgi çekici bir delikanlı; eğer hak ettiği servete sahip olsaydı daha iyisini yapamazdın derdim. Ama bu haliyle kendini hayallerine kaptırmamalısın. Senin sağduyun var ve hepimiz sağduyunu kullandığını görmek istiyoruz. Baban kararlarına ve davranışlarına güveniyor, eminim. Babanı hayal kırıklığına uğratmamalısın.
es: ––Eres una chica demasiado sensata, Lizzy, para enamorarte sólo porque se te haya advertido que no lo hicieses; y por eso, me atrevo a hablarte abiertamente. En serio, ten cuidado. No te comprometas, ni dejes que él se vea envuelto en un cariño que la falta de fortuna puede convertir en una imprudencia. Nada tengo que decir contra él; es un muchacho muy interesante, y si tuviera la posición que debería tener, me parecería inmejorable. Pero tal y como están las cosas, no puedes cegarte. Tienes mucho sentido, y todos esperamos que lo uses. Tu padre confía en tu firmeza y en tu buena conducta. No vayas a defraudarle.
vi_translation: - Lizzy, you are mature enough not to fall in love just because you are warned against it. Therefore, I will not hesitate to speak frankly. I need to caution you, and I am serious about this. You should not get entangled with him in a relationship where material desires might make love reckless. I have nothing against him; he is someone worthy of our attention; and if he had the wealth he should have inherited, I could say there would be nothing better for you. You are sensible, and everyone expects you to use your sense. I believe your father will rely on your steadfastness and virtue. You should not disappoint your father.
tr_translation: "You are a very sensible girl, Lizzy, you won't fall in love with anyone just because you were warned; so I am not afraid to speak openly with you. Seriously, I advise you to protect yourself. Do not enter into or try to force a relationship that would be impossible due to lack of money. I have nothing against him; he is a very interesting young man; if he had the fortune he deserved, I would say you couldn't do better. But in his current state, you must not let yourself get carried away by dreams. You have common sense, and we all want to see you use it. Your father trusts your decisions and actions, I am sure. You must not disappoint your father."
es_translation: ––You are a girl too sensible, Lizzy, to fall in love just because you were warned not to; and for that reason, I dare to speak to you openly. Seriously, be careful. Do not commit yourself, nor let him get involved in an affection that the lack of fortune can turn into imprudence. I have nothing to say against him; he is a very interesting young man, and if he had the position he should have, he would seem unbeatable to me. But as things stand, you cannot blind yourself. You have a lot of sense, and we all expect you to use it. Your father trusts in your firmness and good conduct. Do not disappoint him.

en: “Well, then, you need not be under any alarm. I will take care of myself, and of Mr. Wickham too. He shall not be in love with me, if I can prevent it.”
vi: - Như thế thì mợ không nên lo âu. Cháu biết lo cho cháu, cho anh Wickham nữa. Anh ấy sẽ không yêu cháu, nếu cháu có thể ngăn cản được.
tr: "İyi öyleyse; telaş etmenize gerek yok. Kendime göz kulak olurum, tabii Mr Wickham'a da. Bana âşık olmayacaktır, önleyebilirsem yani.
es: ––Bueno, no te alarmes. Me cuidaré de Wickham. Si lo puedo evitar, no se enamorará de mí.
vi_translation: - In that case, you shouldn't worry. I know how to take care of myself, and of Mr. Wickham too. He wouldn't love me if I could prevent it.
tr_translation: "Well then; there's no need for you to worry. I will take care of myself, and of course, Mr. Wickham too. He will not fall in love with me, if I can help it."
es_translation: ––Well, don't be alarmed. I will take care of Wickham. If I can avoid it, he will not fall in love with me.

en: “As I did the other day,” said Elizabeth, with a conscious smile; “very true, it will be wise in me to refrain from that. But do not imagine that he is always here so often. It is on your account that he has been so frequently invited this week. You know my mother’s ideas as to the necessity of constant company for her friends. But really, and upon my honour, I will try to do what I think to be wisest; and now I hope you are satisfied.”
vi: Elizabeth nở một nụ cười có ý thức: - Như hôm ấy cháu đã nhắc. Đúng vậy, cháu nên khôn ngoan đừng làm việc này. Nhưng mợ không nên nghĩ anh ấy luôn đến đây. Mợ đã nhận thấy tuần này anh thường được mời đến. Mợ biết đấy, ý tưởng của mẹ cháu là muốn những người thân của bà luôn có người kề cận. Nhưng thật ra, cháu xin lấy danh dự mà nói rằng cháu sẽ cố gắng làm điều mà cháu tin là khôn ngoan nhất. Và bây giờ, cháu nghĩ mợ đã an tâm.
tr: "Geçen gün yaptığım gibi," dedi Elizabeth anlamlı bir gülümsemeyle: "çok doğru, bundan vazgeçsem iyi olur. Ama o kadar sık geldiğini sanmayın. Bu hafta sizin sayenizde bu kadar sık davet edildi. Annemin her an eş dost istediğini bilirsiniz. Ama gerçekten, şeref sözü, bana en akıllıca gelen şeyi yapacağım; şimdi umarım tatmin olmuşsunuzdur.
es: ––Como hice el otro día ––repuso Elizabeth con maliciosa sonrisa––. Es verdad, sería lo más oportuno. Pero no vayas a imaginar que viene tan a menudo. Si le hemos invitado tanto esta semana, es porque tú estabas aquí. Ya sabes la obsesión de mi madre de que sus visitas estén constantemente acompañadas. Pero de veras, te doy mi palabra de que trataré siempre de hacer lo que crea más sensato. Espero que ahora estarás más contenta.
vi_translation: Elizabeth gave a conscious smile. - As I reminded you that day. That's right, you should be wise and not do this. But you shouldn't think he always comes here. You noticed that this week he has often been invited. You know, my mother's idea is to always have her loved ones close by. But honestly, I swear on my honor that I will try to do what I believe is the wisest. And now, I think you are reassured.
tr_translation: "Like I did the other day," said Elizabeth with a meaningful smile: "very true, I should give it up." But don't think it happens that often. This week, thanks to you, I've been invited so frequently. You know my mother always wants company. But really, I give you my word, I will do what seems most sensible to me; now I hope you are satisfied.""
es_translation: ––As I did the other day ––replied Elizabeth with a malicious smile––. It's true, it would be the most appropriate. But don't go imagining that he comes so often. If we've invited him so much this week, it's because you were here. You know my mother's obsession with having her guests constantly accompanied. But truly, I give you my word that I will always try to do what I believe is most sensible. I hope you are happier now.

en: Her aunt assured her that she was; and Elizabeth, having thanked her for the kindness of her hints, they parted,—a wonderful instance of advice being given on such a point without being resented.
vi: Bà mợ nói cho cô cháu an tâm rằng bà đã hả dạ, Elizabeth cảm ơn bà đã có lòng tốt khuyên nhủ cô. Hai mợ cháu từ giã nhau, sau một tình huống lời khuyên nhủ được chấp nhận mà không gây phật ý
tr: Yengesi tatmin olduğunu söyledi, Elizabeth de ona uyarılarındaki nezaket için teşekkür ettikten sonra ayrıldılar; böyle bir konuda öğüt vermenin ve gücendirmemenin olağandışı bir örneği.
es: Su tía le aseguró que lo estaba; Elizabeth le agradeció sus amables advertencias, y se fueron. Su conversación había constituido un admirable ejemplo de saber aconsejar sin causar resentimiento.
vi_translation: Aunt reassured her niece that she was satisfied, and Elizabeth thanked her for her kind advice. The two parted ways, after a situation where advice was accepted without causing offense..
tr_translation: Her sister-in-law said she was satisfied, and after Elizabeth thanked her for her courtesy in the warnings, they parted ways; an unusual example of giving advice on such a matter without causing offense.
es_translation: Her aunt assured her that she was; Elizabeth thanked her for her kind warnings, and they left. Their conversation had been an admirable example of how to give advice without causing resentment.

en: “I shall depend on hearing from you very often, Eliza.”
vi: - Eliza, chị mong em sẽ liên lạc với chị thường xuyên.
tr: "Senden sık sık haber alacağıma inanıyorum, Eliza.
es: ––Confío en que tendré noticias tuyas muy a menudo, Eliza.
vi_translation: - Eliza, I hope you will keep in touch with me often.
tr_translation: "I believe I will hear from you often, Eliza."
es_translation: ––I trust that I will hear from you very often, Eliza.

en: “Well,” cried Elizabeth, “have it as you choose. He shall be mercenary, and she shall be foolish.”
vi: Elizabeth thốt lên: - Được rồi, tuỳ ý mợ nghĩ. Anh ấy hám lợi, còn cô ấy ngu xuẩn.
tr: "Valla," diye haykırdı Elizabeth, "nasıl isterseniz öyle deyin. Adam paragöz olsun, kız da aptal olsun.
es: ––Bueno ––exclamó Elizabeth––, como tú quieras. Pongamos que él es un cazador de dotes y ella una tonta.
vi_translation: Elizabeth exclaimed: - Alright, it's up to you to think. He is greedy, and she is foolish.
tr_translation: "Well," cried Elizabeth, "say whatever you like. Let the man be greedy, and the girl be foolish."
es_translation: ––Well ––exclaimed Elizabeth––, as you wish. Let's say he is a fortune hunter and she is a fool.

en: EVERY object in the next day’s journey was new and interesting to Elizabeth; and her spirits were in a state of enjoyment; for she had seen her sister looking so well as to banish all fear for her health, and the prospect of her northern tour was a constant source of delight.
vi: Mọi điều trong chặng đường ngày kế đều mới lạ và thích thú đối với Elizabeth. Tinh thần cô phấn chấn vì cô đã thấy người chị trong tình trạng sức khỏe tốt nên không phải lo ngại gì, và viễn cảnh chuyến đi về miền Bắc là nguồn vui bất tận.
tr: Ertesi günkü yolculukta gördüğü herşey Elizabeth için yeni ve ilginçti; keyifli bir ruh hali içindeydi çünkü ablasını sağlığıyla ilgili tüm korkularını giderecek kadar iyi görmüştü ve kuzey turu yapma olasılığı onun için sürekli bir neşe kaynağıydı.
es: Al día siguiente todo era nuevo e interesante para Elizabeth. Estaba dispuesta a pasarlo bien y muy animada, pues había encontrado a su hermana con muy buen aspecto y todos los temores que su salud le inspiraba se hablan desvanecido. Además, la perspectiva de un viaje por el Norte era para ella una constante fuente de dicha.
vi_translation: Everything on the next day's journey was new and exciting for Elizabeth. Her spirits were high because she had seen her sister in good health and had no worries, and the prospect of the trip to the North was a source of endless joy.
tr_translation: Everything Elizabeth saw on the journey the next day was new and interesting to her; she was in a cheerful mood because she had seen her sister well enough to dispel all her fears about her health, and the possibility of taking a northern tour was a constant source of joy for her.
es_translation: The next day everything was new and interesting for Elizabeth. She was determined to have a good time and was very cheerful, as she had found her sister in very good health, and all the fears she had about her health had vanished. Moreover, the prospect of a trip to the North was for her a constant source of joy.

en: When they left the high road for the lane to Hunsford, every eye was in search of the Parsonage, and every turning expected to bring it in view. The paling of Rosings park was their boundary on one side. Elizabeth smiled at the recollection of all that she had heard of its inhabitants.
vi: Khi họ tách ra khỏi đường cái để đi đến Huntsford, mọi con mắt đều tìm kiếm toà Tư dinh Cha xứ, mà ai nấy đều nghĩ sau mọi ngã rẽ có thể được nhìn thấy Vòng rào khu Rosings Park là ranh giới ở một bên. Elizabeth mỉm cười khi nhớ lại những gì cô đã nghe về những người ngụ nơi đây.
tr: Ana yoldan çıkıp Hunsford yoluna saptıkları zaman bütün gözler Rahip Lojmanı'nı aramaya başladı ve her dönemeçten sonra şimdi görünecek diye beklendi. Rosings Korusu'nun çiti bir yandaki sınırlarını çiziyordu. Elizabeth mülkün sakinleri hakkında bütün o duyduklarını gülümseyerek hatırladı.
es: Cuando dejaron el camino real para entrar en el sendero de Hunsford, los ojos de todos buscaban la casa del párroco y a cada revuelta creían que iban a divisarla. A un lado del sendero corría la empalizada de la finca de Rosings. Elizabeth sonrió al acordarse de todo lo que había oído decir de sus habitantes.
vi_translation: When they turned off the main road to go to Huntsford, every eye was searching for the Parsonage, which everyone thought could be seen after every turn, with the boundary of Rosings Park on one side. Elizabeth smiled as she recalled what she had heard about the inhabitants of this place.
tr_translation: When they left the main road and turned onto the Hunsford road, all eyes began to search for the Parsonage, expecting it to appear after every bend. The fence of Rosings Park marked their boundaries on one side. Elizabeth smiled as she remembered all that she had heard about the inhabitants of the estate.
es_translation: When they left the main road to enter the Hunsford path, everyone's eyes searched for the parsonage and at every turn they thought they were going to see it. On one side of the path ran the fence of the Rosings estate. Elizabeth smiled as she remembered everything she had heard about its inhabitants.

en: About the middle of the next day, as she was in her room getting ready for a walk, a sudden noise below seemed to speak the whole house in confusion; and, after listening a moment, she heard somebody running upstairs in a violent hurry, and calling loudly after her. She opened the door, and met Maria in the landing-place, who, breathless with agitation, cried out,—
vi: Giữa ngày kế, khi cô đang chuẩn bị ra ngoài đi dạo, một tiếng động thình lình dường như làm cả ngôi nhà rối loạn. Sau một lúc nghe ngóng, cô nghe tiếng chân một người chạy hối hả lên các bậc cầu thang và lớn tiếng gọi cô. Cô mở cánh cửa, gặp Maria ở bậc cầu thang, hổn hển thốt lên:
tr: Ertesi günün ortasına doğru, odasında, yürüyüş hazırlığı yaparken, aşağıdan gelen ani bir gürültü bütün evi altüst eder gibi oldu; bir an dinledikten sonra, vahşi bir acele içinde birinin merdivenden yukarı koştuğunu ve ona bağırdığını duydu. Kapıyı açtı, sahanlıkta Maria'yı gördü; heyecandan nefesi kesilmiş, haykırıyordu-
es: Al día siguiente, a eso de las doce, estaba en su cuarto preparándose para salir a dar un paseo, cuando oyó abajo un repentino ruido que pareció que sembraba la confusión en toda la casa. Escuchó un momento y advirtió que alguien subía la escalera apresuradamente y la llamaba a voces. Abrió la puerta y en el corredor se encontró con María agitadísima y sin aliento, que exclamó:
vi_translation: In the middle of the next day, as she was preparing to go out for a walk, a sudden noise seemed to throw the entire house into chaos. After listening for a moment, she heard the hurried footsteps of someone running up the stairs and loudly calling her name. She opened the door and met Maria on the stairs, who breathlessly exclaimed:
tr_translation: By the middle of the next day, while preparing for a walk in his room, a sudden noise from downstairs seemed to turn the whole house upside down; after listening for a moment, he heard someone running up the stairs in a wild rush and shouting at him. He opened the door and saw Maria on the landing; out of breath from excitement, she was shouting-
es_translation: The next day, around noon, she was in her room getting ready to go out for a walk, when she heard a sudden noise downstairs that seemed to throw the whole house into confusion. She listened for a moment and noticed that someone was hurriedly coming up the stairs and calling out to her loudly. She opened the door and in the hallway she found María, very agitated and out of breath, who exclaimed:

en: “I like her appearance,” said Elizabeth, struck with other ideas. “She looks sickly and cross. Yes, she will do for him very well. She will make him a very proper wife.”
vi: Elizabeth nói: - Chị thích vóc dáng cô ấy. Thình lình Elizabeth có một ý nghĩ mới. “Cô trông yếu đuối và cáu gắt. Đúng vậy, cô sẽ xứng với anh ấy. Cô sẽ là một người vợ rất hợp với anh”.
tr: "Görünüşünü sevdim," dedi Elizabeth, aklı başka düşüncelerle meşgul halde. "Hasta ve huysuz görünüyor. Evet, ona iyi gelir. Ona gayet uygun bir eş olur.
es: ––Me gusta su aspecto ––dijo Elizabeth, pensando en otras cosas––. Parece enferma y malhumorada. Sí, es la mujer apropiada para él, le va mucho.
vi_translation: Elizabeth said: - She likes her figure. Suddenly, Elizabeth had a new thought. "She looks weak and irritable. Yes, she will suit him. She will be a very fitting wife for him."
tr_translation: "I liked his appearance," said Elizabeth, her mind occupied with other thoughts. "He looks sick and irritable. Yes, it will do him good. She would make a very suitable wife for him."
es_translation: ––I like her appearance ––said Elizabeth, thinking about other things––. She looks sick and ill-tempered. Yes, she is the right woman for him, she suits him well.

en: “I am the less surprised at what has happened,” replied Sir William, “from that knowledge of what the manners of the great really are, which my situation in life has allowed me to acquire. About the court, such instances of elegant breeding are not uncommon.”
vi: Ngài William đáp: - Tôi ít ngạc nhiên hơn về chuyện đã xảy ra, do hoàn cảnh của cuộc đời tôi đã giúp tôi hiểu biết về tư cách thật sự của giới thượng lưu. Nói về triều đình, những trường hợp gia giáo nho nhã như thế thì không hiếm.
tr: "Ben o kadar şaşırmadım," diye cevapladı Sir William, "neden derseniz, büyük insanların tarzlarını bilirim, hayattaki konumum o tarzı edinmeme imkân vermiştir. Saray çevresinde bu tip incelikler az görülür şey değildir.
es: ––A mí no me sorprende ––replicó sir William––, porque mi situación en la vida me ha permitido conocer el verdadero modo de ser de los grandes. En la corte esos ejemplos de educación tan elegante son muy normales.
vi_translation: Sir William replied: - I am less surprised by what happened, as the circumstances of my life have helped me understand the true nature of the upper class. Speaking of the court, such cases of refined upbringing are not uncommon.
tr_translation: "I wasn't that surprised," replied Sir William, "if you ask why, it's because I know the manners of great people, my position in life has allowed me to acquire that style. Such refinements are not uncommon in the court circles."
es_translation: ––I am not surprised ––replied Sir William––, because my position in life has allowed me to know the true nature of the great. In the court, such examples of elegant manners are very common.

en: Elizabeth could hardly help smiling, as she assured her that had not been the case.
vi: Elizabeth không thể không mỉm cười khi cô giải thích rằng không phải như thế.
tr: Elizabeth durumun öyle olmadığını söylerken elinde olmadan gülümsedi.
es: Elizabeth casi no pudo reprimir una sonrisa al asegurarle que no había sido así.
vi_translation: Elizabeth couldn't help but smile as she explained that it wasn't like that.
tr_translation: Elizabeth couldn't help but smile as she said that wasn't the case.
es_translation: Elizabeth could hardly suppress a smile as she assured him that it had not been so.

en: His arrival was soon known at the Parsonage; for Mr. Collins was walking the whole morning within view of the lodges opening into Hunsford Lane, in order to have
vi: Chẳng bao lâu, cả khu Tư dinh Cha xứ đều biết việc anh sắp đến, vì anh Collins đã đi bộ cả buổi sáng chung quanh Huntsford để báo tin, sau khi đã cúi đầu chào tại Rosings Park, anh vội đi về nhà với tin tức quan trọng nhất.
tr: Mr Darcy'nin gelişi lojmanda hemen duyuldu, çünkü Mr Collins bütün sabah Hunsford Yolu'na açılan müştemilatın görüş alanı içinde yürümüş durmuştu geldiğini o an tespit etmek için, ve araba Koru'ya dönerken eğilip selamını verdikten sonra büyük havadisle koşa koşa eve gelmişti.
es: Su llegada se supo en seguida, pues Collins llevaba toda la mañana paseando con la vista fija en los templetes de la entrada al camino de Hunsford; en cuanto vio que el coche entraba en la finca, hizo su correspondiente reverencia, y corrió a casa a dar la magna noticia.
vi_translation: Not long after, the entire Parish House knew about his impending visit, because Mr. Collins had spent the entire morning walking around Huntsford spreading the news.
tr_translation: Mr. Darcy's arrival at the parsonage was immediately noticed, because Mr. Collins had spent the entire morning walking within the view of the outbuildings that opened onto Hunsford Road in order to detect the exact moment of his arrival, and after bowing as the carriage turned into the Grove, he had rushed back to the house with the great news.
es_translation: Their arrival was known immediately, for Collins had been strolling all morning with his eyes fixed on the pavilions at the entrance to the Hunsford road; as soon as he saw the carriage enter the estate, he made his corresponding bow, and ran home to deliver the grand news.

en: Mr. Darcy spoke with affectionate praise of his sister’s proficiency.
vi: Anh Darcy ca ngợi một cách trìu mến sự tinh thông của cô em.
tr: Mr Darcy kızkardeşinin yeteneğinden duygulu bir övgüyle bahsetti.
es: ¿Cómo va Georgiana, Darcy? Darcy hizo un cordial elogio de lo adelantada que iba su hermana.
vi_translation: Mr. Darcy lovingly praised his sister's proficiency.
tr_translation: Mr. Darcy spoke with emotional praise about his sister's talent.
es_translation: Darcy made a cordial compliment about how advanced his sister was.

en: “I am very glad to hear such a good account of her,” said Lady Catherine; “and pray tell her from me, that she cannot expect to excel, if she does not practise a great deal.”
vi: Phu nhân Catherine nói: - Dì rất vui được nghe cháu nói về cô ấy, và xin nhờ chuyển lời dì đến cô ấy rằng, cô không thể trở thành xuất chúng nếu cô không luyện tập nhiều.
tr: "Bunu duyduğuma çok sevindim," dedi Lady Catherine; "lütfen ona çok pratik yapmazsa asla başarılı olamaz dediğimi söyle.
es: ––Me alegro mucho de que me des tan buenas noticias ––dijo lady Catherine––, y te ruego que le digas de mi parte que si no practica mucho, no mejorará nada.
vi_translation: Lady Catherine said: - Auntie is very happy to hear you talk about her, and please convey Auntie's message to her that she cannot become outstanding if she does not practice a lot.
tr_translation: "I am very glad to hear that," said Lady Catherine; "please tell her that she will never succeed unless she practices a great deal.""
es_translation: ––I am very glad that you give me such good news ––said Lady Catherine––, and I beg you to tell her on my behalf that if she does not practice a lot, she will not improve at all.

en: Mr. Darcy looked a little ashamed of his aunt’s ill-breeding, and made no answer.
vi: Anh Darcy có vẻ hơi ngượng về phong thái của bà dì nhưng không trả lời.
tr: Mr Darcy teyzesinin densizliğinden biraz utandı, ve cevap vermedi.
es: Darcy pareció un poco avergonzado de la mala educación de su tía, y no contestó.
vi_translation: Mr. Darcy seemed a bit embarrassed by his aunt's demeanor but did not reply.
tr_translation: Mr. Darcy was a bit embarrassed by his aunt's rudeness and did not respond.
es_translation: Darcy seemed a little embarrassed by his aunt's rudeness, and did not reply.

en: “Pray let me hear what you have to accuse him of,” cried Colonel Fitzwilliam. “I should like to know how he behaves among strangers.”
vi: Đại tá Fitzwilliam thốt lên: - Xin cho tôi nghe cô kết án anh ấy về những việc gì. Tôi cần biết anh ấy đối xử với thiên hạ ra sao.
tr: "Lütfen onu neyle suçladığınızı bana da söyleyin," diye haykırdı Albay Fitzwilliam. "Yabancıların arasında nasıl davrandığını bilmek isterim.
es: ––Dígame, por favor, de qué le acusa ––exclamó el coronel Fitzwilliam––. Me gustaría saber cómo se comporta entre extraños.
vi_translation: Colonel Fitzwilliam exclaimed: - Please let me hear what you accuse him of. I need to know how he treats others.
tr_translation: "Please tell me what you are accusing him of," cried Colonel Fitzwilliam. "I want to know how he behaves among strangers."
es_translation: ––Tell me, please, what you accuse him of ––exclaimed Colonel Fitzwilliam––. I would like to know how he behaves among strangers.

en: “You shall hear, then—but prepare for something very dreadful. The first time of my ever seeing him in Hertfordshire, you must know, was at a ball—and at this ball, what do you think he did? He danced only four dances! I am sorry to pain you, but so it was. He danced only four dances, though gentlemen were scarce; and, to my certain knowledge, more than one young lady was sitting down in want of a partner. Mr. Darcy, you cannot deny the fact.”
vi: - Thế thì anh sẽ nghe, nhưng nên chuẩn bị nghe điều kinh khiếp. Lần đầu tiên tôi gặp anh ấy tại Hertfordshire, anh biết chứ, là tại một buổi dạ vũ, và trong buổi dạ vũ này, anh nghĩ anh ấy đã làm gì? Chỉ khiêu vũ bốn bản! Xin lỗi đã làm anh đau lòng, nhưng đúng như thế. Anh ấy chỉ khiêu vũ bốn bản, mặc dù thanh niên thì hiếm hoi, và tôi biết rõ có một cô gái trẻ phải ngồi ngoài vì thiếu bạn nhảy. Anh Darcy, anh không thể chối bỏ sự kiện.
tr: "Dinleyin o halde –ama kendinizi çok feci bir şeye hazırlayın. Onu Hertfordshire'de ilk gördüğümde balodaydık –ve bu baloda bilin bakalım ne yaptı? Sadece dört kez dans etti! Sizi üzdüğüm için özür dilerim –ama öyle. Az erkek olduğu halde sadece dört dans; ve iyi biliyorum ki birçok hanım eş yokluğundan oturup kalmıştı. Mr Darcy, yaptığınızı inkâr edemezsiniz.
es: ––Se lo diré, pero prepárese a oír algo muy espantoso. Ha de saber que la primera vez que le vi fue en un baile, y en ese baile, ¿qué cree usted que hizo? Pues no bailó más que cuatro piezas, a pesar de escasear los caballeros, y más de una dama se quedó sentada por falta de pareja. Señor Darcy, no puede negarlo.
vi_translation: - Then you will listen, but be prepared to hear something dreadful. The first time I met him was in Hertfordshire, you know, at a ball, and at this ball, do you know what he did? He only danced four dances! Sorry to break your heart, but that's the truth. He only danced four dances, even though young men were scarce, and I know for a fact that there was a young girl who had to sit out because there were not enough dance partners. Mr. Darcy, you cannot deny the fact.
tr_translation: "Listen then –but prepare yourself for something very dreadful. When I first saw him in Hertfordshire, we were at a ball –and guess what he did at this ball? He danced only four times! I apologize for upsetting you –but that's how it was. Only four dances, despite the lack of men; and I know very well that many ladies were left sitting due to the absence of partners. Mr. Darcy, you cannot deny what you did."
es_translation: ––I will tell you, but prepare yourself to hear something very dreadful. You must know that the first time I saw him was at a ball, and at that ball, what do you think he did? Well, he only danced four pieces, despite the scarcity of gentlemen, and more than one lady was left sitting for lack of a partner. Mr. Darcy, you cannot deny it.

en: “Perhaps,” said Darcy, “I should have judged better had I sought an introduction, but I am ill-qualified to recommend myself to strangers.”
vi: Darcy nói: - Có thể tôi nên suy xét kỹ hơn nếu tôi tìm cách được giới thiệu, nhưng tôi không có đủ tư cách để tự giới thiệu với người lạ.
tr: "Belki," dedi Darcy, "farklı davranırdım, tanışma imkânı arasaydım; ama kendimi yabancılara tanıtmak konusunda beceriksizim.
es: ––Puede que me habría juzgado mejor ––añadió Darcy–– si hubiese solicitado que me presentaran. Pero no sirvo para darme a conocer a extraños.
vi_translation: Darcy said: - Perhaps I should consider more carefully if I seek an introduction, but I am not qualified to introduce myself to strangers.
tr_translation: "Perhaps," said Darcy, "I would behave differently if I sought the opportunity to meet; but I am inept at introducing myself to strangers."
es_translation: ––Perhaps you would have judged me better ––added Darcy–– if I had requested an introduction. But I am not good at making myself known to strangers.

en: “I certainly have not the talent which some people possess,” said Darcy, “of conversing easily with those I have never seen before. I cannot catch their tone of conversation, or appear interested in their concerns, as I often see done.”
vi: Darcy nói: - Chắc chắn tôi không có tài năng mà vài người có, để trò chuyện dễ dàng với người mà mình chưa từng gặp trước đây. Tôi không thể tham gia vào những câu chuyện của họ hoặc tỏ ra quan tâm đến những vấn đề của họ, như tôi thường thấy họ làm.
tr: "Bazı insanların sahip olduğu yetenek bende yok," dedi Darcy, "daha önce görmediğim insanlarla rahat konuşma yeteneği. Başkaları gibi konuşmalarının tonunu yakalayamıyorum, sözettikleri şeylere ilgi duyuyormuş gibi görünemiyorum.
es: ––Reconozco ––dijo Darcy–– que no tengo la habilidad que otros poseen de conversar fácilmente con las personas que jamás he visto. No puedo hacerme a esas conversaciones y fingir que me intereso por sus cosas como se acostumbra.
vi_translation: Darcy said: - I certainly don't have the talent that some people possess, to easily converse with someone they've never met before. I can't join in their conversations or show interest in their issues, as I often see them do.
tr_translation: "I don't have the talent that some people possess," said Darcy, "the ability to comfortably talk to people I haven't met before. I can't catch the tone of their conversations like others do, I can't seem to show interest in the things they talk about."
es_translation: ––I acknowledge ––said Darcy–– that I do not have the ability that others possess to converse easily with people I have never seen. I cannot engage in those conversations and pretend to be interested in their affairs as is customary.

en: “My fingers,” said Elizabeth, “do not move over this instrument in the masterly manner which I see so many women’s do. They have not the same force or rapidity, and do not produce the same expression. But then I have always supposed it to be my own fault—because I would not take the trouble of practising. It is not that I do not believe my fingers as capable as any other woman’s of superior execution.”
vi: Elizabeth nói: - Các ngón tay của tôi không được điêu luyện trên cây đàn này như rất nhiều cô gái khác, vì không có cùng sức mạnh hay sự điêu luyện, và không diễn tả cùng cảm xúc. Nhưng rồi tôi luôn cho đấy là lỗi của tôi – bởi vì tôi không chịu khó luyện tập. Không phải là tôi không tin các ngón tay của tôi có cùng khả năng như bất kỳ phụ nữ nào chơi hay hơn tôi.
tr: "Parmaklarım," dedi Elizabeth, "bu aletin üstünde birçok kadının parmakları gibi ustaca gezinmiyor. Aynı güce, aynı hıza sahip değiller, aynı ifadeyi de yaratmıyorlar. Ama ben bunun hep kendi hatam olduğunu düşündüm –pratik yapma sıkıntısına katlanmadığım için. Yoksa benim parmaklarımın başka bir kadının parmakları gibi üstün beceriye sahip olamayacağına inandığımdan değil.
es: ––Mis dedos ––repuso Elizabeth–– no se mueven sobre este instrumento del modo magistral con que he visto moverse los dedos de otras mujeres; no tienen la misma fuerza ni la misma agilidad, y no pueden producir la misma impresión. Pero siempre he creído que era culpa mía, por no haberme querido tomar el trabajo de hacer ejercicios. No porque mis dedos no sean capaces, como los de cualquier otra mujer, de tocar perfectamente.
vi_translation: Elizabeth said: - My fingers are not as skillful on this instrument as many other girls', because they lack the same strength or dexterity, and do not express the same emotions. But then I always considered it my fault – because I did not practice diligently. It's not that I don't believe my fingers have the same potential as any woman who plays better than me.
tr_translation: "My fingers," said Elizabeth, "do not skillfully glide over this instrument like the fingers of many women. They do not have the same strength, the same speed, nor do they create the same expression. But I always thought that this was my own fault – because I did not endure the trouble of practicing. Not because I believed that my fingers could not possess the superior skill like another woman's fingers."
es_translation: ––My fingers ––replied Elizabeth–– do not move over this instrument in the masterful way I have seen other women's fingers move; they do not have the same strength or agility, and they cannot produce the same impression. But I have always believed it was my fault, for not wanting to take the trouble to do exercises. Not because my fingers are not capable, like those of any other woman, of playing perfectly.

en: Darcy smiled and said, “You are perfectly right. You have employed your time much better. No one admitted to the privilege of hearing you can think anything wanting. We neither of us perform to strangers.”
vi: Darcy mỉm cười: - Cô hoàn toàn đúng. Cô đã dùng thời giờ của cô một cách ích lợi hơn rất nhiều. Không một ai được đặc quyền nghe cô đàn lại có thể nghĩ còn có yếu kém gì. Cả hai chúng ta đều không trình diễn cho người lạ.
tr: Darcy gülümsedi ve şöyle dedi, "Çok haklısınız. Zamanınızı çok daha iyi kullanmışsınız. Sizi dinleme ayrıcalığı kazanmış hiç kimse herhangi bir kusur bulamaz. Biz ikimiz de yabancılara çalmayız.
es: Darcy sonrió y le dijo: ––Tiene usted toda la razón. Ha empleado el tiempo mucho mejor. Nadie que tenga el privilegio de escucharla podrá ponerle peros. Ninguno de nosotros toca ante desconocidos.
vi_translation: Darcy smiled: - You are absolutely right. You have used your time much more beneficially. No one who has the privilege of hearing you play can think there is any weakness. Neither of us performs for strangers.
tr_translation: Darcy smiled and said, "You are very right. You have used your time much better. No one who has had the privilege of listening to you can find any fault. We both do not play for strangers."
es_translation: Darcy smiled and said to her: ––You are absolutely right. You have used your time much better. No one who has the privilege of listening to you will be able to find fault. None of us perform in front of strangers.

en: “If he means to be but little at Netherfield, it would be better for the neighbourhood that he should give up the place entirely, for then we might possibly get a settled family there. But, perhaps, Mr. Bingley did not take the house so much for the convenience of the neighbourhood as for his own, and we must expect him to keep or quit it on the same principle.”
vi: - Nếu anh ấy định ít khi lưu lại Netherfield, có thể tốt hơn cho láng giềng nếu anh trả lại hẳn ngôi nhà, vì lúc ấy chúng tôi có thể có một gia đình định cư hẳn ở đấy. Nhưng có lẽ anh Bingley dùng ngôi nhà không phải cho sự tiện lợi của láng giềng mà là vì sự thuận tiện của chính anh ấy, và chúng tôi nghĩ anh sẽ giữ hoặc trả lại ngôi nhà theo cùng nguyên tắc ấy.
tr: "Netherfield'de pek kalmayı düşünmüyorsa orayı tümden bırakması muhit için daha iyi olur, çünkü o zaman oraya bir aile yerleşebilir. Ama belki Mr Bingley evi muhite yararı olsun diye değil kendisi için tutmuştur; bu aynı nedenle de tutacak ya da bırakacaktır herhalde.
es: ––Si tiene la intención de estar poco tiempo en Netherfield, sería mejor para la vecindad que lo dejase completamente, y así posiblemente podría instalarse otra familia allí. Pero quizá el señor Bingley no haya tomado la casa tanto por la conveniencia de la vecindad como por la suya propia, y es de esperar que la conserve o la deje en virtud de ese mismo principio.
vi_translation: - If he intends to rarely stay at Netherfield, it might be better for the neighbors if he returns the house entirely, because then we could have a family permanently settled there. But perhaps Mr. Bingley uses the house not for the convenience of the neighbors but for his own convenience, and we think he will keep or return the house based on that same principle.
tr_translation: "If he does not intend to stay long at Netherfield, it would be better for the neighborhood if he left it altogether, because then a family could settle there. But perhaps Mr. Bingley has rented the house not for the benefit of the neighborhood, but for himself; and he will probably keep it or leave it for the same reason."
es_translation: ––If you intend to stay for a short time at Netherfield, it would be better for the neighborhood if you left it completely, and thus possibly another family could settle there. But perhaps Mr. Bingley has taken the house not so much for the convenience of the neighborhood as for his own, and it is to be hoped that he will keep it or leave it based on that same principle.

en: “Mr. Collins appears very fortunate in his choice of a wife.”
vi: - Anh Collins xem ra có may mắn trong việc chọn lựa người vợ của anh.
tr: "Mr Collins eş seçiminde çok talihli görünüyor.
es: ––El señor Collins parece haber sido muy afortunado con la elección de su esposa.
vi_translation: - Mr. Collins seems to be fortunate in choosing his wife.
tr_translation: "Mr. Collins seems very fortunate in his choice of wife.""
es_translation: ––Mr. Collins seems to have been very fortunate in the choice of his wife.

en: “I do not mean to say that a woman may not be settled too near her family. The far and the near must be relative, and depend on many varying circumstances. Where there is fortune to make the expense of travelling unimportant, distance becomes no evil. But that is not the case here. Mr. and Mrs. Collins have a comfortable income, but not such a one as will allow of frequent journeys—and I am persuaded my friend would not call herself near her family under less than half the present distance.”
vi: - Tôi không có ý nói một phụ nữ không nên ổn định quá gần gia đình bà. Xa hay gần chỉ là tương đối, tùy thuộc vào nhiều hoàn cảnh khác nhau. Khi có điều kiện khiến chi phí đi lại không thành vấn đề, khoảng cách không là gì cả. Nhưng đấy không phải là trường hợp ở đây. Ông bà Collins có thu nhập thoải mái, nhưng vẫn không đủ để đi về thường xuyên – và tôi tin bà bạn của tôi sẽ không cho rằng mình ở gần gia đình của mình ngay cả khi khoảng cách chỉ còn một nửa.
tr: "Bir kadının ailesinin çok yakınına yerleşemeyeceğini söylemek istemiyorum. Uzak ve yakın göreceli olmalı; birçok değişik unsura bağlı. Seyahat masraflarını önemsiz kılacak servet olunca mesafe sorun olmaz. Ama burada durum bu değil. Mr ve Mrs Collins rahat bir gelire sahipler, ama sık yolculuklara izin verecek kadar da değil –bence arkadaşım bunun yarısı kadar bir mesafede otuyor olmadan kendini ailesine yakın saymazdı.
es: ––No quiero decir que una mujer no pueda vivir lejos de su familia. Lejos y cerca son cosas relativas y dependen de muy distintas circunstancias. Si se tiene fortuna para no dar importancia a los gastos de los viajes, la distancia es lo de menos. Pero éste no es el caso. Los señores Collins no viven con estrecheces, pero no son tan ricos como para permitirse viajar con frecuencia; estoy segura de que mi amiga no diría que vive cerca de su familia más que si estuviera a la mitad de esta distancia.
vi_translation: - I do not mean to say that a woman should not settle too close to her family. Far or near is only relative, depending on various circumstances. When conditions make travel costs not an issue, distance means nothing. But that is not the case here. Mr. and Mrs. Collins have a comfortable income, but still not enough to travel frequently – and I believe my friend would not consider herself close to her family even if the distance were halved.
tr_translation: "I do not mean to say that a woman may not settle too near her family. Distance and nearness are relative; they depend on many varying circumstances. When there is fortune to make the expenses of traveling unimportant, distance becomes no evil. But that is not the case here. Mr. and Mrs. Collins have a comfortable income, but not enough to allow for frequent journeys – I think my friend would not consider herself near her family unless she lived at half that distance."
es_translation: ––I don't mean to say that a woman cannot live far from her family. Far and near are relative things and depend on very different circumstances. If one has the fortune not to worry about travel expenses, the distance is the least of it. But this is not the case. The Collinses do not live in straitened circumstances, but they are not so wealthy as to afford frequent travel; I am sure my friend would not say she lives close to her family unless she were at half this distance.

en: “And if not able to please himself in the arrangement, he has at least great pleasure in the power of choice. I do not know anybody who seems more to enjoy the power of doing what he likes than Mr. Darcy.”
vi: - Nếu anh ấy không được như ý thích sắp xếp, ít nhất anh ấy sẽ thích có quyền quyết định. Tôi chưa từng biết có người nào thích có quyền làm theo ý mình hơn anh Darcy.
tr: "Ayarlamadan memnun kalmazsa en azından seçme şansına sahip olduğu için memnun olabilir. Dilediğini yapma gücüne sahip olmayı Mr Darcy'den daha çok seven kimseyi görmedim.
es: ––Y si no le placen las cosas por lo menos le da un gran placer el poder disponerlas a su antojo. No conozco a nadie que parezca gozar más con el poder de hacer lo que quiere que el señor Darcy.
vi_translation: - If he doesn't get things arranged to his liking, at least he will like having the right to decide. I have never known anyone who likes having the right to do as they please more than Mr. Darcy.
tr_translation: "If she is not pleased with the arrangement, at least she can be satisfied with having had the choice. I have never seen anyone who loves having the power to do as they wish more than Mr. Darcy."
es_translation: ––And if he does not like things, at least he takes great pleasure in being able to arrange them as he pleases. I do not know anyone who seems to enjoy the power to do what he wants more than Mr. Darcy.

en: “Is this,” thought Elizabeth, “meant for me?” and she coloured at the idea; but, recovering herself, said in a lively tone, “And pray, what is the usual price of an earl’s younger son? Unless the elder brother is very sickly, I suppose you would not ask above fifty thousand pounds.”
vi: Elizabeth nghĩ, “liệu câu này có nhắm đến mình không?”, và cô đỏ mặt với ý tưởng. Nhưng cô trấn tĩnh lại, vui vẻ nói: - Xin anh cho biết, cái giá thông thường của người con trai trẻ của một Bá tước là như thế nào? Trừ khi cậu anh họ đang bị bệnh, tôi đoán anh sẽ không yêu cầu trên năm mươi nghìn bảng.
tr: "Acaba," diye düşündü Elizabeth, "bununla beni mi kastediyor?" ve düşüncesi yüzünü kızarttı; ama, kendini toparlayınca, neşeli bir sesle şöyle dedi, "Tanrı aşkına, söyler misiniz, bir kontun küçük oğlunun normal bedeli nedir? Ağabeyi çok hasta değilse, herhalde elli bin pound'dan fazla istemezsiniz.
es: «¿Se referirá esto a mí?», pensó Elizabeth sonrojándose. Pero reponiéndose contestó en tono jovial: ––Y dígame, ¿cuál es el precio normal de un hijo menor de un conde? A no ser que el hermano mayor esté muy enfermo, no pedirán ustedes más de cincuenta mil libras...
vi_translation: Elizabeth thought, "Is this remark aimed at me?" and she blushed at the idea. But she composed herself and cheerfully said: - Could you please tell me, what is the usual price for a young son of an Earl? Unless your cousin is ill, I guess you wouldn't ask for more than fifty thousand pounds.
tr_translation: "I wonder," thought Elizabeth, "is he referring to me with this?" and the thought made her blush; but, pulling herself together, she said in a cheerful voice, "For God's sake, can you tell me, what is the usual price for the younger son of an earl? If his elder brother is not very ill, surely you wouldn't ask for more than fifty thousand pounds."
es_translation: "Could this be referring to me?" thought Elizabeth, blushing. But recovering, she replied in a jovial tone: ––And tell me, what is the usual price for the younger son of an earl? Unless the elder brother is very ill, you wouldn't ask for more than fifty thousand pounds...

en: “Are you, indeed? And pray what sort of a guardian do you make? Does your charge give you much trouble? Young ladies of her age are sometimes a little difficult to manage; and if she has the true Darcy spirit, she may like to have her own way.”
vi: - Thật thế à? Và xin cho hỏi, anh bảo hộ theo cách nào? Cô ấy có gây khó khăn cho anh không? Những thiếu nữ ở tuổi cô đôi lúc khó quản lý, nên nếu cô ấy thật sự có tính khí nhà Darcy, cô có thể muốn làm theo ý mình.
tr: "Öyle mi gerçekten? Tanrı bilir nasıl birer veli olmuşsunuzdur? Küçük hanım sizi çok üzüyor mu? O yaştaki genç kızları çekip çevirmek biraz zordur; hele kendisinde gerçek Darcy ruhu varsa bildiğini okumak isteyebilir.
es: ––¿De veras? Y dígame, ¿qué clase de tutoría es la que ejercen? ¿Les da mucho que hacer? Las chicas de su edad son a veces un poco difíciles de gobernar, y si tiene el mismo carácter que el señor Darcy, le debe de gustar también hacer su santa voluntad.
vi_translation: - Really? And may I ask, how do you protect her? Does she cause you any trouble? Young ladies at her age can sometimes be difficult to manage, so if she truly has the Darcy temperament, she might want to do things her own way.
tr_translation: "Is that really so? God knows what kind of saints you have become? Does the young lady upset you a lot? It is a bit difficult to manage young girls at that age; especially if she has the true Darcy spirit, she may want to do as she pleases."
es_translation: ––Really? And tell me, what kind of tutelage do you provide? Does it keep you very busy? Girls of her age can sometimes be a bit difficult to manage, and if she has the same character as Mr. Darcy, she must also like to have her own way.

en: “I know them a little. Their brother is a pleasant, gentlemanlike man—he is a great friend of Darcy’s.”
vi: - Tôi có quen sơ với họ. Em trai của họ là một người dễ mến – anh ấy chơi thân với anh Darcy.
tr: "Biraz tanıyorum. Kardeşleri hoş bir beyefendi –Darcy'nin yakın arkadaşı.
es: ––Algo, sí. Su hermano es un caballero muy agradable, íntimo amigo de Darcy.
vi_translation: - I am somewhat acquainted with them. Their younger brother is a pleasant person – he is close friends with Mr. Darcy.
tr_translation: "I know him a little. His brothers are pleasant gentlemen – Darcy's close friend."
es_translation: ––Something, yes. Her brother is a very pleasant gentleman, an intimate friend of Darcy.

en: “Did Mr. Darcy give you his reasons for this interference?”
vi: - Anh Darcy có cho anh biết lý do nào anh ấy muốn can dự như thế không?
tr: "Mr Darcy size müdahale nedenlerini söyledi mi?
es: ––¿Le dijo a usted el señor Darcy las razones que tuvo para inmiscuirse en el asunto?
vi_translation: - Did Mr. Darcy tell you any reason why he wanted to get involved like that?
tr_translation: "Did Mr. Darcy tell you the reasons for his intervention?"
es_translation: ––Did Mr. Darcy tell you the reasons he had for interfering in the matter?

en: “I do not see what right Mr. Darcy had to decide on the propriety of his friend’s inclination; or why, upon his own judgment alone, he was to determine and direct in what manner that friend was to be happy. But,” she continued, recollecting herself, “as we know none of the particulars, it is not fair to condemn him. It is not to be supposed that there was much affection in the case.”
vi: - Tôi nghĩ anh Darcy không có quyền gì mà phê phán tình cảm của bạn anh là đúng hay sai, hoặc tại sao chỉ dựa trên phán quyết của riêng mình mà anh ấy lại xác định và chỉ đạo bạn mình phải có hạnh phúc theo cách nào. Cô tiếp, trầm tĩnh lại: - Nhưng, vì chúng ta không biết chi tiết gì, kết án anh ấy là không công bằng. Không thể giả định là có nhiều tình cảm trong trường hợp này.
tr: "Mr Darcy'nin, arkadaşının isteğinin uygun olup olmadığına karar vermeye ne hakkı var, ya da arkadaşının ne şekilde mutlu olacağını kendi başına nasıl belirliyor, yönlendiriyor, anlamıyorum." "Ama," diye devam etti, kendini toplayarak, "ayrıntıları bilmediğimiz için onu kınamak adilce olmaz. Belli ki ortada kaydadeğer bir sevgi yokmuş.
es: ––¿Quiere decir que su intervención fue indiscreta? ––No veo qué derecho puede tener el señor Darcy para decidir sobre una inclinación de su amigo y por qué haya de ser él el que dirija y determine, a su juicio, de qué modo ha de ser su amigo feliz. Pero ––continuó, reportándose––, no sabiendo detalles, no está bien censurarle. Habrá que creer que el amor no tuvo mucho que ver en este caso.
vi_translation: - I think Mr. Darcy has no right to judge whether his friend's feelings are right or wrong, or why he should determine and dictate how his friend should find happiness based solely on his own judgment. She continued, calming down: - But, since we don't know any details, condemning him is unfair. We cannot assume that there are many emotions involved in this case.
tr_translation: "What right does Mr. Darcy have to decide whether his friend's wish is appropriate, or how does he determine and direct what will make his friend happy, I don't understand." "But," he continued, collecting himself, "it would not be fair to condemn him as we do not know the details. Clearly, there was no significant affection involved."
es_translation: ––I don't see what right Mr. Darcy has to decide on his friend's inclination and why he should be the one to direct and determine, in his judgment, how his friend should be happy. But ––he continued, composing himself––, not knowing the details, it is not right to criticize him. One must believe that love had little to do with this case.

en: “That is not an unnatural surmise,” said Fitzwilliam; “but it is lessening the honour of my cousin’s triumph very sadly.”
vi: Fitzwilliam nói: - Đây không phải là một phỏng đoán gượng ép, nhưng nó làm suy giảm một cách đáng buồn vinh quang chiến thắng của anh họ tôi.
tr: "Bu yanlış bir varsayım değil," dedi Fitzwilliam, "ama kuzenimin zaferinin ihtişamını hüzünlü bir şekilde azaltıyor.
