tr_translation: "My father has gone to London; Jane also wrote a letter asking for my uncle's help; we will leave within half an hour, I hope. But there is nothing to be done; I know, there isn't. How can such a man be persuaded? How will we find them? I have no hope. It's dreadful in every way!"
es_translation: ––My father has gone to London and Jane writes requesting my uncle's immediate help; I hope we will leave within half an hour. But nothing can be done, I know nothing can be done. How to convince such a man? How to discover them? I have not the slightest hope. Any way you look at it, it is horrible.

en: Darcy shook his head in silent acquiescence.
vi: Darcy lắc đầu mặc nhận. Cô tiếp:
tr: Darcy sessiz bir onaylama içinde başını salladı.
es: Darcy asintió con la cabeza en silencio.
vi_translation: Darcy shook his head in acknowledgment. She continued:
tr_translation: Darcy nodded in silent approval.
es_translation: Darcy nodded silently.

en: “Do you really think so?” cried Elizabeth, brightening up for a moment.
vi: Elizabeth thốt lên, mặt lộ nét tươi vui trong phút chốc: - Cậu thật sự tin như thế à
tr: "Gerçekten öyle mi düşünüyorsunuz?" diye haykırdı Elizabeth, bir an için canlanarak.
es: ––¿Lo crees así de veras? ––preguntó Elizabeth animándose por un momento.
vi_translation: Elizabeth exclaimed, her face momentarily lighting up with joy: - Do you really believe that?
tr_translation: "Do you really think so?" cried Elizabeth, coming to life for a moment.
es_translation: ––Do you really believe that? ––asked Elizabeth, brightening up for a moment.

en: “In the first place,” replied Mr. Gardiner, “there is no absolute proof that they are not gone to Scotland.”
vi: Ông Gardiner đáp: - Trước nhất, không có bằng cớ xác đáng cho thấy họ không đi Scotland.
tr: "Bir kere," diye cevapladı Mr Gardiner, "İskoçya'ya gitmediklerinin kesin kanıtı yok.
es: ––En primer lugar ––contestó el señor Gardiner––, no hay pruebas de que no hayan ido.
vi_translation: Mr. Gardiner replied: - First of all, there is no conclusive evidence that they did not go to Scotland.
tr_translation: "For one thing," replied Mr. Gardiner, "there is no definite proof that they did not go to Scotland."
es_translation: ––First of all ––replied Mr. Gardiner––, there is no evidence that they haven't gone.

en: “But can you think that Lydia is so lost to everything but love of him, as to consent to live with him on any other terms than marriage?”
vi: - Nhưng cháu có thể nghĩ rằng Lydia sẽ bị mất mát rất nhiều ngoại trừ tình yêu của anh, đến nỗi nó cam lòng sống với anh theo cách thức nào đấy khác hơn là hôn nhân, hay sao?
tr: "Ama Lydia'nın ona evlilik dışı bir hayat sürmeye razı olacak, gözü hiçbir şeyi görmeyecek kadar körkütük aşık olduğunu düşebiliyor musun?
es: ––Pero ¿cómo supones que Lydia sea tan inconsiderada para todo lo que no sea amarle, que consienta en vivir con él de otra manera que siendo su mujer legítima?
vi_translation: - But can you think that Lydia would lose so much except for your love, that she would be willing to live with you in any way other than marriage?
tr_translation: "But can you imagine that Lydia is so blindly in love that she would agree to live a life outside of marriage, not seeing anything else?"
es_translation: ––But how do you suppose that Lydia is so inconsiderate about everything except loving him, that she would agree to live with him in any other way than as his legitimate wife?

en: “And do you really know all this?” cried Mrs. Gardiner, whose curiosity as to the mode of her intelligence was all alive.
vi: Bà Gardiner thốt lên, ngạc nhiên về cách cô thu thập thông tin: - Và cháu thật sự biết hết các việc này à
tr: "Bütün bunları gerçekten biliyor musun?" diye haykırdı Mrs Gardiner; bunların nereden bilindiği konusundaki merakı iyice uyanmıştı.
es: ––¿Estás segura? ––preguntó la señora Gardiner que ardía en deseos de conocer la fuente de información de su sobrina.
vi_translation: Mrs. Gardiner exclaimed, surprised at how she gathered information: - And you really know all these things??
tr_translation: "Do you really know all this?" cried Mrs. Gardiner; her curiosity about where this information came from was thoroughly aroused.
es_translation: ––Are you sure? ––asked Mrs. Gardiner, who was burning with the desire to know the source of her niece's information.

en: It may be easily believed, that however little of novelty could be added to their fears, hopes, and conjectures, on this interesting subject by its repeated discussion, no other could detain them from it long, during the whole of the journey. From Elizabeth’s thoughts it was never absent. Fixed there by the keenest of all anguish, self-reproach, she could find no interval of ease or forgetfulness.
vi: Dù cho không có nhiều điều gì mới lạ thêm vào những lo âu, hi vọng và phỏng đoán, không ai có thể gạt bỏ những tâm tư này được lâu trong suốt cuộc hành trình. Tâm trí Elizabeth luôn luôn vướng bận. Bọ dằn vặt vì mọi khổ não và tự trách móc, không lúc nào cô cảm thấy thoải mái hoặc tạm quên vụ việc.
tr: Bu önemli konudaki korkularına, umutlarına ve dileklerine tekrar tekrar konuşmakla pek yeni bir şey eklenemeyeceği kolayca tahmin edilebilirse de bütün yolculuk boyu başka hiçbir konu onları bundan uzun süre ayıramadı. Elizabeth'in düşüncelerinden hiç çıkmadı. Tüm ızdırap ve vicdan azabıyla sıkı sıkı oraya yerleşmişti ve ne bir an rahat nefes almasına ne de unutmasına izin verdi.
es: Aunque pocas cosas nuevas podían añadir a sus temores, esperanzas y conjeturas sobre tan interesante asunto, los viajeros lo debatieron durante todo el camino. Elizabeth no podía pensar en otra cosa. La más punzante de todas las angustias, el reproche a sí misma, le impedía encontrar el menor intervalo de alivio o de olvido.
vi_translation: Even though there wasn't much new to add to the worries, hopes, and speculations, no one could dismiss these thoughts for long throughout the journey. Elizabeth's mind was always preoccupied. Tormented by all the distress and self-blame, she never felt comfortable or temporarily forgot the incident.
tr_translation: Although it could easily be anticipated that nothing new could be added by repeatedly talking about their fears, hopes, and wishes on this important matter, no other topic could distract them from it for long throughout the entire journey. It never left Elizabeth's thoughts. It had firmly settled there with all its torment and pangs of conscience, not allowing her a moment's peace or forgetfulness.
es_translation: Although few new things could be added to their fears, hopes, and conjectures about such an interesting matter, the travelers debated it throughout the entire journey. Elizabeth could not think of anything else. The sharpest of all agonies, self-reproach, prevented her from finding the slightest interval of relief or forgetfulness.

en: Elizabeth, as she affectionately embraced her, whilst tears filled the eyes of both, lost not a moment in asking whether anything had been heard of the fugitives.
vi: Elizabeth trìu mến ôm lấy cô chị, nước mặt giàn giụa nhưng không bỏ phí thời khắc nào. Cô hỏi đã có tin tức của hai kẻ bỏ đi trốn không.
tr: Elizabeth onu sevgiyle kucaklarken, gözyaşları ikisinin de gözlerini doldururken, bir an bile kaybetmeden kaçaklarla ilgili yeni bir haber olup olmadığını sordu.
es: Se abrazaron con efusión, con los ojos llenos de lágrimas, y Elizabeth preguntó sin perder un segundo si se había sabido algo de los fugitivos.
vi_translation: Elizabeth affectionately hugged her sister, tears streaming down but not wasting a moment. She asked if there was any news of the two who had run away.
tr_translation: As Elizabeth embraced him with love, while tears filled both of their eyes, she asked without losing a moment if there was any news about the fugitives.
es_translation: They embraced warmly, with eyes full of tears, and Elizabeth asked without wasting a second if there had been any news of the fugitives.

en: “Not yet,” replied Jane. “But now that my dear uncle is come, I hope everything will be well.”
vi: Jnae đáp: - Chưa. Nhưng bây giờ có cậu đến đây, chị mong mọi việc sẽ tốt đẹp.
tr: "Henüz yok," diye cevapladı Jane. "Ama dayım geldiğine göre artık umarım herşey yoluna girer.
es: ––Todavía no ––respondió Jane––, pero ahora que ya ha llegado nuestro querido tío, espero que todo vaya bien.
vi_translation: Jane replied: - Not yet. But now that you are here, I hope everything will be fine.
tr_translation: "Not yet," Jane replied. "But now that my uncle is here, I hope everything will be alright.""
es_translation: ––Not yet ––replied Jane––, but now that our dear uncle has arrived, I hope everything goes well.

en: “But you—how are you?” cried Elizabeth. “You look pale. How much you must have gone through!”
vi: Elizabeth thốt lên: - Nhưng còn chị, chị ra sao? Trông chị tái xanh. Chị đã phải trải qua bao khổ sở?
tr: "Peki sen –Sen nasılsın?" diye haykırdı Elizabeth. "Solgun görünüyorsun. Kimbilir neler çektin!
es: ––¿Y tú, cómo te encuentras? ––preguntó Elizabeth––. Estás pálida. ¡Cuánto habrás tenido que pasar!
vi_translation: Elizabeth exclaimed: - But what about you, how are you? You look pale. You've had to go through so much suffering?
tr_translation: "Well, you – How are you?" cried Elizabeth. "You look pale. Who knows what you've been through!"
es_translation: ––And you, how are you feeling? ––asked Elizabeth––. You look pale. You must have gone through so much!

en: But Mr. Gardiner, though he assured her again of his earnest endeavours in the cause, could not avoid recommending moderation to her, as well in her hopes as her fears; and after talking with her in this manner till dinner was on table, they left her to vent all her feelings on the housekeeper, who attended in the absence of her daughters.
vi: Nhưng ông Gardiner, dù đã trấn an ba lần nữa rằng ông sẽ cố gắng, vẫn muốn khuyên bà nên giữ bình tĩnh trong hi vọng cũng như trong lo sợ. Họ cố khuyên giải bà như thế cho đến giờ ăn tối, rồi họ để bà ở lại trút mọi tâm tư lên người quản gia đi đến để chăm sóc bà trong khi các cô con gái dùng bữa.
tr: Mr Gardiner o amaçla elinden geleni yapacağını ifade ettiyse de ona korkusunda da umutlarında da ılımlı olmasını tavsiye etmeden duramadı; akşam yemeği masaya gelene kadar onunla bu şekilde konuştuktan sonra tüm duygularını kızlarının yokluğunda hizmetini üstlenen kahyaya boşaltması için yanından ayrıldılar.
es: El señor Gardiner le repitió que haría todo lo que pudiera y le recomendó que moderase sus esperanzas y sus temores. Conversó con ella de este modo hasta que la comida estuvo en la mesa, y la dejó que se desahogase con el ama de llaves que la asistía en ausencia de sus hijas.
vi_translation: But Mr. Gardiner, despite reassuring three more times that he would try, still wanted to advise her to remain calm in both hope and fear. They tried to console her in this way until dinner time, then they left her to pour out all her thoughts to the housekeeper who came to take care of her while the daughters had their meal.
tr_translation: Although Mr. Gardiner expressed that he would do his best for that purpose, he could not refrain from advising him to be moderate in both his fears and hopes; after talking to him in this way until dinner was served, they left his side so that he could vent all his emotions to the butler who had taken over his daughter's duties in her absence.
es_translation: Mr. Gardiner repeated to her that he would do everything he could and advised her to moderate her hopes and fears. He conversed with her in this manner until the meal was on the table, and left her to vent with the housekeeper who assisted her in the absence of her daughters.

en: “And till Colonel Forster came himself, not one of you entertained a doubt, I suppose, of their being really married?”
vi: - Em nghĩ, trước khi đại tá Forster đến đây, không ai trong gia đình nghi ngờ việc họ sẽ thật sự kết hôn, có phải thế không?
tr: "Albay Forster bizzat gelene kadar galiba hiçbiriniz gerçekten evleneceklerinden şüphe etmiyordunuz değil mi?
es: ––Supongo que hasta que vino el coronel Forster, nadie de la casa dudó de que estuviesen casados.
vi_translation: - Do you think that before Colonel Forster came here, no one in the family suspected that they would actually get married, right?
tr_translation: "Until Colonel Forster came in person, none of you really doubted that they would get married, did you?"
es_translation: ––I suppose that until Colonel Forster came, no one in the house doubted that they were married.

en: “Oh, Jane, had we been less secret, had we told what we knew of him, this could not have happened!”
vi: - Ôi, Jane, nếu hai chị em ta không quá kín đáo, nếu chúng mình đã kể cho mọi người nghe những gì chúng mình biết về anh ta, việc này hẳn sẽ không xảy ra!
tr: "Ah Jane, daha az sır tutsaydık, hakkında bildiklerimizi söyleseydik bunlar hiç olmayabilirdi.
es: ––¡Oh, Jane! Si no hubiésemos sido tan reservadas y hubiéramos dicho lo que sabíamos de Wickham, esto no habría sucedido.
vi_translation: - Oh, Jane, if we hadn't been so secretive, if we had told everyone what we knew about him, this wouldn't have happened!
tr_translation: "Ah Jane, if we had kept fewer secrets and told you what we knew about you, none of this might have happened."
es_translation: ––Oh, Jane! If we hadn't been so reserved and had said what we knew about Wickham, this wouldn't have happened.

en: “Lydia Bennet.”
vi: Lydia Bennet”
tr: Lydia Bennet.
es: Lydia Bennet
vi_translation: Lydia Bennet
tr_translation: Lydia Bennet."
es_translation: Lydia Bennet

en: “She had better have stayed at home,” cried Elizabeth: “perhaps she meant well, but, under such a misfortune as this, one cannot see too little of one’s neighbours. Assistance is impossible; condolence, insufferable. Let them triumph over us at a distance, and be satisfied.”
vi: Elizabeth thốt lên: - Đáng lẽ bà không nên đến; có lẽ bà có ý tốt, nhưng trong cảnh vô phúc như thế này không thể nghĩ quá tốt về hàng xóm. Hỗ trợ thì không thể được; an ủi thì không thể chịu đựng nổi. Hãy để họ chiến thắng từ nơi xa, và thoả chí.
tr: "Keşke evinde kalsaydı," diye haykırdı Elizabeth; "belki iyi niyetlidir ama böyle bir talihsizlik karşısında insan komşularını ne kadar az görse o kadar iyidir. Yardım etmek imkânsız, teselli etmek katlanılmaz bir şey. Uzaktan keyiflensinler, tatmin olsunlar.
es: ––Más habría valido que se hubiese quedado en su casa ––dijo Elizabeth––; puede que sus intenciones fueran buenas; pero en desgracias como ésta se debe rehuir de los vecinos. No pueden ayudarnos y su condolencia es ofensiva. ¡Que se complazcan criticándonos a distancia!
vi_translation: Elizabeth exclaimed: - You shouldn't have come; maybe you had good intentions, but in such unfortunate circumstances, one cannot think too highly of neighbors. Support is impossible; consolation is unbearable. Let them triumph from afar, and be satisfied.
tr_translation: "I wish she had stayed at home," cried Elizabeth; "she may have good intentions, but in the face of such misfortune, the less one sees their neighbors, the better. Helping is impossible, comforting is unbearable. Let them enjoy and be satisfied from afar."
es_translation: ––It would have been better if he had stayed at home ––said Elizabeth––; his intentions may have been good, but in misfortunes like this, one should avoid neighbors. They cannot help us and their condolences are offensive. Let them take pleasure in criticizing us from a distance!

en: When Mr. Bennet arrived, he had all the appearance of his usual philosophic composure. He said as little as he had ever been in the habit of saying; made no mention of the business that had taken him away; and it was some time before his daughters had courage to speak of it.
vi: Khi ông Bennet về đến, ông hoàn toàn có vẻ bề ngoài điềm đạm thường nhật. Ông cũng ít nói như theo thói quen, không đả động đến sự việc đã khiến ông phải ra đi, và phải sau một thời gian các cô con gái mới có đủ can đảm hỏi han ông.
tr: Mr Bennet geldiğinde her zamanki filozofça soğukkanlılığı üstündeydi. Her zamanki alışkanlığıyla az konuştu; onu oralara götüren işten hiç bahsetmedi, kızlarının bunu konuşacak cesareti bulmaları da biraz zaman aldı.
es: El señor Bennet llegó con su acostumbrado aspecto de filósofo. Habló poco, como siempre; no dijo nada del motivo que le había impulsado a regresar, y pasó algún tiempo antes de que sus hijas tuvieran el valor de hablar del tema.
vi_translation: When Mr. Bennet returned home, he had his usual calm demeanor. He was as taciturn as ever, not mentioning the matter that had caused him to leave, and it was only after some time that his daughters had the courage to ask him about it.
tr_translation: Mr. Bennet, when he arrived, was in his usual philosophical calmness. He spoke little, as was his custom; he did not mention the business that had taken him there, and it took some time for his daughters to muster the courage to talk about it.
es_translation: Mr. Bennet arrived with his usual philosophical demeanor. He spoke little, as always; he said nothing about the reason that had prompted his return, and some time passed before his daughters had the courage to speak on the subject.

en: It was not till the afternoon, when he joined them at tea, that Elizabeth ventured to introduce the subject; and then, on her briefly expressing her sorrow for what he must have endured, he replied, “Say nothing of that. Who should suffer but myself? It has been my own doing, and I ought to feel it.”
vi: Vào buổi chiều, khi ông dùng trà với các con mình, Elizabeth bắt đầu câu chuyện, và rồi, khi cô tỏ ý ái ngại về sự chịu đựng của ông, ông trả lời: - Đừng nói gì về việc này. Ai chịu khổ sở nếu không phải là bố? Việc này là do bố gây ra, bố phải cảm thấy điều ấy.
tr: Sonunda öğleden sonra çay için onlara katıldı ve ancak o zaman Elizabeth meseleye giriş yapmayı göze alabildi; sonra, neler çekmiş olması gerektiği konusundaki üzüntülerini ifade etmesi üzerine şöyle dedi, "Bundan bahsetme. Ben çekmeyeceğim de kim çekecek? Benim yüzümden oldu, cezasını çekmem gerek.
es: Por la tarde, cuando se reunió con ellas a la hora del té, Elizabeth se aventuró a tocar la cuestión; expresó en pocas palabras su pena por lo que su padre debía haber sufrido, y éste contestó: ––Déjate. ¿Quién iba a sufrir sino yo? Ha sido por mi culpa y está bien que lo pague.
vi_translation: In the afternoon, when he had tea with his children, Elizabeth started the conversation, and then, when she expressed concern about his endurance, he replied: - Don't say anything about this. Who suffers if not Dad? This is caused by Dad, he has to feel that.
tr_translation: In the end, she joined them for afternoon tea, and only then did Elizabeth dare to broach the subject; then, upon expressing her regrets about what he must have gone through, he said, "Don't talk about it. If I don't suffer, who will? It happened because of me, I must bear the punishment."
es_translation: In the afternoon, when she met with them at tea time, Elizabeth ventured to touch on the matter; she briefly expressed her sorrow for what her father must have suffered, and he replied: ––Let it be. Who else would suffer but me? It was my fault and it's only right that I pay for it.

en: “You must not be too severe upon yourself,” replied Elizabeth.
vi: Elizabeth đáp: - Bố không nên quá khắt khe với chính mình.
tr: "Kendinize karşı bu kadar acımasız olmamalısınız," diye cevapladı Elizabeth.
es: ––No seas tan severo contigo mismo replicó Elizabeth.
vi_translation: Elizabeth replied: - Dad shouldn't be too hard on himself.
tr_translation: "You must not be so hard on yourself," replied Elizabeth.
es_translation: ––Don't be so hard on yourself, replied Elizabeth.

en: Then, after a short silence, he continued, “Lizzy, I bear you no ill-will for being justified in your advice to me last May, which, considering the event, shows some greatness of mind.”
vi: Im lặng một chốc, ông tiếp: - Lizzy, bố không có ý nghĩ gì xấu về con vì con đã có lí khi khuyên bảo bố vào tháng năm rồi. Với biến cố này, những lời khuyên của con cho thấy óc suy nghĩ của con khá lắm.
tr: Sonra, kısa bir sessizliğin ardından devam etti, "Lizzy, bana geçen Mayıs ayında verdiğin tavsiyede haklı çıktığın için sana kızgın değilim; meseleyi düşününce, ne kadar akıllı olduğun görülüyor.
es: Después de un corto silencio, prosiguió: Lizzy, no me guardes rencor por no haber seguido tus consejos del pasado mayo; lo ocurrido demuestra que eran acertados.
vi_translation: After a moment of silence, he continued: - Lizzy, I don't have any bad thoughts about you because you were right when you advised me last May. With this incident, your advice shows that your thinking is quite good.
tr_translation: Then, after a brief silence, he continued, "Lizzy, I am not angry with you for being right in the advice you gave me last May; upon reflection, it shows how wise you are."
es_translation: After a short silence, he continued: Lizzy, don't hold a grudge against me for not having followed your advice last May; what happened shows that you were right.

en: Kitty, who took all these threats in a serious light, began to cry.
vi: Kitty nghĩ mọi lời răn đe này đều nghiêm túc. Cô bắt đầu khóc. Ông bố nói:
tr: Bütün bu tehditleri ciddiye alan Kitty ağlamaya başladı.
es: Catherine se tomó en serio todas estas amenazas y se puso a llorar.
vi_translation: Kitty thought all these warnings were serious. She began to cry. The father said:
tr_translation: Kitty, who took all these threats seriously, started to cry.
es_translation: Catherine took all these threats seriously and began to cry.

en: “Is it possible?” cried Elizabeth, when she had finished. “Can it be possible that he will marry her?”
vi: Elizabeth thốt lên, khi cô đọc xong lá thư: - Có thể như thế được à! Có thể nào anh ấy chịu cưới con nhỏ hay sao?
tr: "Mümkün mü!" diye haykırdı Elizabeth, mektubu bitirdiği zaman. "Lydia'yla evlenmesi mümkün olabilir mi?
es: ––¿Es posible? ––exclamó Elizabeth al terminar la carta––. ¿Será posible que se case con ella?
vi_translation: Elizabeth exclaimed, when she finished reading the letter: - Is that even possible! Could he really agree to marry that girl?
tr_translation: "Is it possible!" cried Elizabeth, when she finished the letter. "Could it be possible for him to marry Lydia?"
es_translation: ––Is it possible? ––exclaimed Elizabeth upon finishing the letter––. Could it be possible that he will marry her?

en: “Let me write for you,” said Jane, “if you dislike the trouble yourself.”
vi: Jane nói: - Để con viết hộ bố, nếu bố không muốn phiền phức.
tr: "Senin yerine ben yazayım," dedi Jane, "sıkıntıya girmek istemiyorsan.
es: ––Deja que yo escriba por ti ––dijo Jane––, si no quieres molestarte.
vi_translation: Jane said: - Let me write it for you, Dad, if you don't want the hassle.
tr_translation: "Let me write it for you," said Jane, "if you don't want to bother."
es_translation: ––Let me write for you ––said Jane––, if you don't want to bother.

en: “Money! my uncle!” cried Jane, “what do you mean, sir?”
vi: Jane thốt lên: - Tiền! Ông cậu con! Bố có ý nói gì?
tr: "Para mı! dayıma mı!" diye haykırdı Jane, "ne demek istiyorsunuz, efendim?
es: ––¿Dinero, mi tío? ––preguntó Jane––. ¿Qué quieres decir?
vi_translation: Jane exclaimed: - Money! Your uncle! What do you mean, Dad?
tr_translation: "Money! To my uncle!" Jane shouted, "what do you mean, sir?"
es_translation: ––Money, my uncle? ––asked Jane––. What do you mean?

en: “That is very true,” said Elizabeth; “though it had not occurred to me before. His debts to be discharged, and something still to remain! Oh, it must be my uncle’s doings! Generous, good man, I am afraid he has distressed himself. A small sum could not do all this.”
vi: Elizabeth nói: - Đúng thế, tuy con đã không nghĩ ra điều này. Mọi món nợ của anh ấy đã được thanh toán, mà còn lại chút ít tiền! Ôi, đây là do cậu con sắp xếp! Một con người độ lượng, tử tế, con ngại ông ấy phải chịu thiệt. Một số tiền nhỏ không thể làm mọi việc này. - Đúng vậy.
tr: "Bu çok doğru," dedi Elizabeth; "daha önce aklıma gelmedi. Borçları ödenecek, geriye de bir şey kalacak! Ah! Dayımın işi olmalı! Ne cömert, ne iyi kalpli bir adam; korkarım kendini sıkıntıya soktu. Bunlar az parayla yapılmış olamaz.
es: ––Es muy cierto ––dijo Elizabeth––; no se me había ocurrido. ¡Pagadas sus deudas y que todavía quede algo! Eso debe de ser obra de mi tío. ¡Qué hombre tan bueno y generoso! Temo que esté pasando apuros, pues con una pequeña cantidad no se hace todo eso.
vi_translation: Elizabeth said: - That's right, although I didn't think of this. All his debts have been paid off, and there's even a little money left! Oh, this is arranged by your son! A generous, kind person, I'm afraid he has to suffer losses. A small amount of money can't do all this.
tr_translation: "This is very true," said Elizabeth; "it hadn't occurred to me before. The debts will be paid off, and there will be something left over! Oh! It must be my uncle's doing! What a generous, kind-hearted man; I fear he has put himself in difficulty. These things couldn't have been done with little money."
es_translation: ––It is very true ––said Elizabeth––; it hadn't occurred to me. Paid off his debts and still something left! That must be my uncle's doing. What a good and generous man! I fear he is in trouble, for with a small amount, you can't do all that.

en: Mr. Bennet made no answer; and each of them, deep in thought, continued silent till they reached the house. Their father then went to the library to write, and the girls walked into the breakfast-room.
vi: Ông Bennet không trả lời, và mỗi người vừa suy nghĩ từ trong ý nghĩ của mình vừa bước về nhà. Ông bố đi vào phòng đọc sách để viết thư trả lời, hai cô gái đi vào phòng ăn sáng.
tr: Mr Bennet cevap vermedi; her biri derin düşünceler içinde sessizce yürüdüler eve kadar. Babaları kütüphaneye, yazmaya gitti, kızlar da kahvaltı odasına gittiler.
es: El señor Bennet no contestó, y, ensimismados todos en sus pensamientos, continuaron en silencio hasta llegar a la casa. El padre se metió en la biblioteca para escribir, y las muchachas se fueron al comedor.
vi_translation: Mr. Bennet did not reply, and each person, lost in their own thoughts, walked back home. The father went into the study to write a reply letter, while the two girls went into the breakfast room.
tr_translation: Mr. Bennet did not reply; each walked in silence, deep in thought, all the way home. Their father went to the library to write, and the girls went to the breakfast room.
es_translation: Mr. Bennet did not reply, and, absorbed in their thoughts, they continued in silence until they reached the house. The father went into the library to write, and the girls went to the dining room.

en: Her eldest daughter endeavoured to give some relief to the violence of these transports, by leading her thoughts to the obligations which Mr. Gardiner’s behaviour laid them all under.
vi: Côn con gái đầu lòng cố gắng kiềm chế cơn sướng thoả mãnh liệt của bà mẹ bằng cách hướng ý nghĩ của bà vào việc gia đình sẽ thụ ân nghĩa cử của ông Gardiner.
tr: En büyük kızı dikkatini Mr Gardiner'ın davranışının hepsine getirdiği yükümlülüklere çekerek bu taşkınlıkların şiddetini biraz olsun azaltmaya çalıştı.
es: La hermana mayor trató de moderar un poco la violencia de su exaltación y de hacer pensar a su madre en las obligaciones que el comportamiento del señor Gardiner les imponía a todos.
vi_translation: The eldest daughter tried to curb her mother's intense pleasure by directing her thoughts to the family's gratitude for Mr. Gardiner's kindness.
tr_translation: The eldest daughter tried to somewhat reduce the intensity of these outbursts by drawing attention to Mr. Gardiner's behavior and the obligations it imposed on everyone.
es_translation: The older sister tried to moderate the violence of her excitement a little and to make her mother think about the obligations that Mr. Gardiner's behavior imposed on all of them.

en: Her husband allowed her to talk on without interruption while the servants remained. But when they had withdrawn, he said to her, “Mrs. Bennet, before you take any, or all of these houses, for your son and daughter, let us come to a right understanding. Into one house in this neighbourhood they shall never have admittance. I will not encourage the imprudence of either, by receiving them at Longbourn.”
vi: Ông chồng bà để cho bà nói mà không ngắt quãng khi có gia nhân chung quanh. Nhưng khi họ rút lui, ông nói với bà: - Bà Bennet, trước khi bà chọn ngôi nhà nào, hoặc tất cả ngôi nhà cho con rể và con gái của bà, chúng ta cần hiểu nhau đúng mức. Hai người sẽ chẳng bao giờ được đặt chân đến một ngôi nhà trong vùng này. Tôi sẽ không khuyến khích thói khinh suất của mấy đứa khác bằng cách tiếp hai người tại Longbourn.
tr: Kocası müdahale etmeden konuşmasına izin verdi, hizmetçiler oradayken. Hizmetçiler çekildikleri zaman ona şöyle dedi, "Mrs Bennet, oğlunuz ya da kızınız için bu evlerin herhangi birini ya da hepsini tutmadan önce bir konuda anlaşalım. Bu muhitteki tek bir eve asla giremezler. Onları Longbourn'da kabul ederek ahlaksızlıklarını ödüllendirmeyeceğim.
es: Su marido la dejaba hablar sin interrumpirla mientras los criados estaban delante. Pero cuando se marcharon, le dijo: ––Señora Bennet, antes de tomar ninguna de esas casas o todas ellas para tu hija, vamos a dejar las cosas claras. Hay en esta vecindad una casa donde nunca serán admitidos. No animaré el impudor de ninguno de los dos recibiéndolos en Longbourn.
vi_translation: The husband let his wife speak without interruption when there were servants around. But when they withdrew, he said to her: - Mrs. Bennet, before you choose any house, or all the houses for your son-in-law and daughter, we need to understand each other properly. They will never set foot in a house in this area. I will not encourage the recklessness of the others by receiving them at Longbourn.
tr_translation: He allowed her to speak without interference while the servants were there. When the servants withdrew, he said to her, "Mrs. Bennet, before you take any of these houses, or all of them, for your son or daughter, let us come to an agreement on one matter. They shall never enter a single house in this neighborhood. I will not reward their immorality by accepting them at Longbourn."
es_translation: Her husband let her speak without interrupting her while the servants were present. But when they left, he said to her: ––Mrs. Bennet, before taking any of those houses or all of them for your daughter, let's make things clear. There is a house in this neighborhood where they will never be admitted. I will not encourage the impudence of either of them by receiving them at Longbourn.

en: They came. The family were assembled in the breakfast-room to receive them. Smiles decked the face of Mrs. Bennet, as the carriage drove up to the door; her husband looked impenetrably grave; her daughters, alarmed, anxious, uneasy.
vi: Hai người đã đến. Cả gia đình tụ tập trong phòng ăn sáng để tiếp đón họ. Những nụ cười trang điểm gương mặt bà Bennet khi cỗ xe chạy đến tận ngạch cửa; ông chồng bà lộ vẻ nghiêm nghị mà không ai đoán được tâm tư ông ra sao; riêng các cô con gái lo lắng, xốn xang, mất tự nhiên.
tr: Geldiler. Aile kahvaltı odasında toplandı, onları karşılamak için. Araba kapıya yanaşırken Mrs Bennet'ın yüzünde gülücükler açtı; kocası nüfuz edilmez biçimde ciddi görünüyordu; kızları telaşlı, endişeli, gergindiler.
es: Llegaron. La familia estaba reunida en el saloncillo esperándolos. La sonrisa adornaba el rostro de la señora Bennet cuando el coche se detuvo frente a la puerta; su marido estaba impenetrablemente serio, y sus hijas, alarmadas, ansiosas e inquietas.
vi_translation: Two people have arrived. The whole family gathered in the breakfast room to welcome them. Smiles adorned Mrs. Bennet's face as the carriage pulled up to the doorstep; her husband bore a serious expression, revealing nothing of his thoughts; the daughters, on the other hand, were anxious, restless, and uneasy.
tr_translation: They arrived. The family gathered in the breakfast room to greet them. As the car approached the door, Mrs. Bennet's face lit up with smiles; her husband appeared impenetrably serious; their daughters were anxious, worried, and tense.
es_translation: They arrived. The family was gathered in the sitting room waiting for them. A smile adorned Mrs. Bennet's face when the carriage stopped in front of the door; her husband was impenetrably serious, and her daughters were alarmed, anxious, and restless.

en: No one but Mrs. Bennet regretted that their stay would be so short; and she made the most of the time by visiting about with her daughter, and having very frequent parties at home. These parties were acceptable to all; to avoid a family circle was even more desirable to such as did think than such as did not.
vi: Chỉ trừ bà Bennet, không ai tỏ ý tiếc hai người ở lại trong thời gian ngắn như thế. Bà tận dụng phần lớn thời gian bằng cách dẫn cô con gái đi thăm viếng người này người nọ, và thường tổ chức những buổi họp mặt ở nhà. Mọi người đều chấp nhận những buổi họp mặt ở nhà như thế; ý nghĩ về việc tránh sum họp gia đình dù sao cũng tốt hơn là không nghĩ gì cả.
tr: Mrs Bennet dışında hiç kimse o kadar kısa kalacak olmalarına üzülmedi; Mrs Bennet zamanı iyi değerlendirdi, kızıyla eşi dostu ziyaret ederek, evde sık sık parti vererek. Bu partiler herkese makul geldi; hatta aile havasından kurtulmak aileden yana dertli olanların olmayanlardan daha çok hoşuna gitti.
es: Nadie, excepto la señora Bennet, sentía que su estancia fuese tan corta. La mayor parte del tiempo se lo pasó en hacer visitas acompañada de su hija y en organizar fiestas en la casa. Las fiestas eran gratas a todos; evitar el círculo familiar era aún más deseable para los que pensaban que para los que no pensaban.
vi_translation: Except for Mrs. Bennet, no one expressed regret that the two stayed for such a short time. She made the most of the time by taking her daughter to visit various people and often organizing gatherings at home. Everyone accepted these gatherings at home; the thought of avoiding family reunions was better than not thinking at all.
tr_translation: No one but Mrs. Bennet was upset that they would stay so briefly; Mrs. Bennet made good use of the time, visiting friends and acquaintances with her daughter, and frequently hosting parties at home. These parties seemed reasonable to everyone; in fact, those troubled by family matters enjoyed escaping the family atmosphere more than those who were not troubled.
es_translation: Nobody, except Mrs. Bennet, felt that their stay was too short. Most of the time was spent making visits accompanied by her daughter and organizing parties at the house. The parties were pleasant for everyone; avoiding the family circle was even more desirable for those who thought than for those who did not think.

en: “If it was to be a secret,” said Jane, “say not another word on the subject. You may depend upon my seeking no further.”
vi: Jane nói: - Nếu là chuyện bí mật, em đừng nói gì nữa. Hai chị sẽ không muốn tìm hiểu thêm.
tr: "Sır kalacaktıysa," dedi Jane, "tek kelime daha etme. Başka bir şey duymak istemediğimden emin olabilirsin.
es: ––Si era un secreto ––dijo Jane–– no digas ni una palabra más. Yo no quiero saberlo.
vi_translation: Jane said: - If it's a secret, don't say anything more. The two of us won't want to know more.
tr_translation: "If it was meant to remain a secret," said Jane, "don't say another word. You can be sure that I don't want to hear anything else."
es_translation: ––If it was a secret ––said Jane–– don't say another word. I don't want to know.

en: “Oh, certainly,” said Elizabeth, though burning with curiosity; “we will ask you no questions.”
vi: Elizabeth nói, tuy bồn chồn vì hiếu kì: - À, đúng thế, hai chị sẽ không hỏi gì cả.
tr: "A elbette," dedi Elizabeth, meraktan alev alev yansa da; "sana soru sormayacağız.
es: ––Naturalmente ––añadió Elizabeth, a pesar de que se moría de curiosidad––, no te preguntaremos nada.
vi_translation: Elizabeth said, though restless with curiosity: - Ah, that's right, you two won't ask anything.
tr_translation: "Oh, of course," said Elizabeth, even though she was burning with curiosity; "we won't ask you any questions."
es_translation: ––Naturally ––added Elizabeth, even though she was dying of curiosity––, we won't ask you anything.

en: On such encouragement to ask, Elizabeth was forced to put it out of her power, by running away.
vi: Với cách khuyến khích hỏi han như thế, Elizabeth bắt buộc phải tránh né bằng cách chạy đi.
tr: Böyle bir soru daveti üzerine Elizabeth dışarı koşarak kendine engel olmak zorunda kaldı.
es: Con semejante incentivo para sonsacarle, Elizabeth se abstuvo de hacerlo y para huir de la tentación se marchó.
vi_translation: With such encouragement to ask questions, Elizabeth was forced to avoid it by running away.
tr_translation: Upon such an invitation to ask a question, Elizabeth ran outside and had to restrain herself.
es_translation: With such an incentive to coax him, Elizabeth refrained from doing so and to avoid the temptation, she left.

en: ELIZABETH had the satisfaction of receiving an answer to her letter as soon as she possibly could. She was no sooner in possession of it, than hurrying into the little copse, where she was least likely to be interrupted, she sat down on one of the benches, and prepared to be happy; for the length of the letter convinced her that it did not contain a denial.
vi: Elizabeth hài lòng nhận được thư hồi âm cho thư của cô, cũng nhanh chóng như cô mong muốn. Ngay khi vừa nhận được lá thư, cô chạy vội ra một bãi cây trong khu vườn nơi cô ít bị làm phiền nhất, ngồi trên một băng ghế và chuẩn bị cho niềm vui, vì lá thư trông khá dài, chứng tỏ không có việc giữ bí mật đối với cô.
tr: Elizabeth mektubuna olabilecek en çabuk şekilde cevap aldı. Mektup eline geçer geçmez en az rahatsız edilebileceği yer olan küçük ağaçlığa seğirtti, sıralardan birine oturup mutlu olmaya hazırlandı; mektup inkârcı olamayacak kadar uzundu çünkü.
es: Elizabeth tuvo la satisfacción de recibir inmediata respuesta a su carta. Corrió con ella al sotillo, donde había menos probabilidades de que la molestaran, se sentó en un banco y se preparó a ser feliz, pues la extensión de la carta la convenció de que no contenía una negativa.
vi_translation: Elizabeth was pleased to receive a reply to her letter as quickly as she had hoped. As soon as she received the letter, she hurried to a grove in the garden where she was least likely to be disturbed, sat on a bench, and prepared for the pleasure, as the letter looked quite long, indicating that there was no secrecy being kept from her.
tr_translation: Elizabeth received a reply to her letter as quickly as possible. As soon as the letter reached her hands, she hurried to the small grove, the place where she would be least disturbed, sat on one of the benches, and prepared to be happy; because the letter was too long to be dismissive.
es_translation: Elizabeth had the satisfaction of receiving an immediate response to her letter. She ran with it to the grove, where there was less chance of being disturbed, sat on a bench, and prepared to be happy, as the length of the letter convinced her that it did not contain a refusal.

en: “Come, Mr. Wickham, we are brother and sister, you know. Do not let us quarrel about the past. In future, I hope we shall be always of one mind.”
vi: - Này, anh Wickham, chúng ta là em rể và chị vợ, anh biết đấy nhé. Ta không nên tranh cãi về quá khứ. Trong tương lai, tôi hi vọng chúng ta luôn đồng ý với nhau.
tr: "Hadi, Mr Wickham, biz artık abla kardeşiz. Geçmiş yüzünden kavga etmeyelim. Gelecekte umarım hep aynı fikirde olacağız.
es: ––Vamos, Wickham; somos hermanos. No discutamos por el pasado. Espero que de ahora en adelante no tengamos por qué discutir.
vi_translation: - Hey, Mr. Wickham, we are brothers-in-law, you know. We should not argue about the past. In the future, I hope we always agree with each other.
tr_translation: "Come on, Mr. Wickham, we are now like siblings. Let's not fight because of the past. I hope we will always agree in the future."
es_translation: ––Come on, Wickham; we are brothers. Let's not argue about the past. I hope that from now on we won't have any reason to argue.

en: Mr. Wickham’s adieus were much more affectionate than his wife’s. He smiled, looked handsome, and said many pretty things.
vi: Anh Wickham giã từ với nhiều vẻ tình cảm hơn vợ anh. Anh tươi cười, có vẻ đẹp trai,nói nhiều điều tốt đẹp.
tr: Mr Wickham'ın vedası karısınınkinden çok daha canayakındı. Gülümsedi, hoş göründü ve birçok tatlı söz söyledi.
es: El adiós de Wickham fue mucho más cariñoso que el de su mujer. Sonrió, estuvo muy agradable y dijo cosas encantadoras.
vi_translation: Mr. Wickham bid farewell with more affection than his wife. He smiled brightly, looked handsome, and said many nice things.
tr_translation: Mr. Wickham's farewell was much more amiable than his wife's. He smiled, looked pleasant, and said many sweet words.
es_translation: Wickham's farewell was much more affectionate than that of his wife. He smiled, was very pleasant, and said charming things.

en: The loss of her daughter made Mrs. Bennet very dull for several days.
vi: Việc mất mát một đứa con gái khiến bà Bennet thẩn thờ trong nhiều ngày.
tr: Kızını kaybetmek Mrs Bennet'ı birkaç gün çok kederli yaptı.
es: La pérdida de su hija sumió en la tristeza a la señora Bennet por varios días.
vi_translation: The loss of a daughter left Mrs. Bennet in a daze for many days.
tr_translation: Losing her daughter made Mrs. Bennet very sorrowful for a few days.
es_translation: The loss of her daughter plunged Mrs. Bennet into sadness for several days.

en: “It is no such thing. Lydia does not leave me because she is married; but only because her husband’s regiment happens to be so far off. If that had been nearer, she would not have gone so soon.”
vi: - Không phải như thế. Lydia xa mẹ không phải vì đi lấy chồng, mà chỉ vì trung đoàn của chồng nó đóng ở nơi xa. Nếu họ đóng ở nơi gần hơn thì con nhỏ không phải đi sớm như thế.
tr: "Öyle bir şey değil. Lydia beni evlendiği için terketmedi; kocasının bölüğü uzakta olduğu için terketti. Yakında olsaydı bu kadar çabuk gitmesi gerekmezdi.
es: No es eso. Lydia no me abandona porque se haya casado, sino porque el regimiento de su marido está lejos. Si hubiera estado más cerca, no se habría marchado tan pronto.
vi_translation: - It's not like that. Lydia is away from her mother not because she got married, but because her husband's regiment is stationed far away. If they were stationed closer, she wouldn't have to leave so soon.
tr_translation: "It's not like that. Lydia didn't leave me because she got married; she left because her husband's regiment was far away. If it were nearby, she wouldn't have had to leave so quickly."
es_translation: That's not it. Lydia doesn't leave me because she got married, but because her husband's regiment is far away. If it had been closer, she wouldn't have left so soon.

en: “I saw you look at me to-day, Lizzy, when my aunt told us of the present report; and I know I appeared distressed; but don’t imagine it was from any silly cause. I was only confused for the moment, because I felt that I should be looked at. I do assure you that the news does not affect me either with pleasure or pain. I am glad of one thing, that he comes alone; because we shall see the less of him. Not that I am afraid of myself, but I dread other people’s remarks.”
vi: - Lizzy, chị thấy em dò xét nhìn chị khi dì chúng ta báo tin, và chị biết chị lộ vẻ đau khổ. Nhưng em đừng nghỉ đây là do một nguyên nhân ngu xuẩn nào. Chị chỉ hoang mang trong một khoảnh khắc, vì chị nghĩ chị sẽ phải bị dò xét. Chị muốn em tin rằng chị không vui hoặc buồn gì cả về tin này. Chị chỉ mừng với một điều, đấy là ta sẽ ít gặp anh hơn, bởi vì anh ấy sẽ trở lại một mình. Không phải chị e sợ về mình, nhưng chị chán ngán những lời bình phẩm của thiên hạ.
tr: "Bugün teyzem bu haberi verince bana baktığını gördüm, Lizzy; rahatsız göründüğümü biliyorum. Ama aptal bir sebepten olduğunu düşünme. Sadece bir an kafam karıştı, çünkü bana bakılacağını hissettim. Haberin bana sevinç ya da üzüntü vermediğinden emin ol. Sadece bir şeye memnunum, yalnız başına geliyor; o zaman onu daha az görürüz. Kendimden korktuğumdan değil, ama başkalarının sözlerinden dehşet duyuyorum.
es: ––He notado, Elizabeth, que cuando mi tía comentaba la noticia del día, me estabas mirando. Ya sé que pareció que me dio apuro, pero no te figures que era por alguna tontería. Me quedé confusa un momento porque me di cuenta de que me estaríais observando. Te aseguro que la noticia no me da tristeza ni gusto. De una cosa me alegro: de que viene solo, porque así lo veremos menos. No es que tenga miedo por mí, pero temo los comentarios de la gente.
vi_translation: - Lizzy, I saw you scrutinizing me when our aunt announced the news, and I know I appeared distressed. But don't think this is due to some foolish reason. I was just momentarily confused because I thought I would be scrutinized. I want you to believe that I am neither happy nor sad about this news. I am only glad about one thing, which is that we will see him less, because he will return alone. It's not that I fear for myself, but I am tired of people's comments.
tr_translation: "When my aunt gave this news today, I saw you looking at me, Lizzy; I know I seemed disturbed. But don't think it was for a foolish reason. I was just confused for a moment because I felt like I was being watched. Be assured that the news neither brought me joy nor sorrow. I'm only pleased about one thing, that he is coming alone; then we will see him less. It's not that I'm afraid of myself, but I'm horrified by what others might say."
es_translation: ––I have noticed, Elizabeth, that when my aunt was commenting on the news of the day, you were looking at me. I know it seemed like I was embarrassed, but don't think it was for some silly reason. I was confused for a moment because I realized you all were watching me. I assure you that the news neither saddens nor pleases me. One thing I am glad about: that he is coming alone, because that way we will see him less. It's not that I'm afraid for myself, but I fear people's comments.

en: Mrs. Bennet had been strongly inclined to ask them to stay and dine there that day; but, though she always kept a very good table, she did not think anything less than two courses could be good enough for a man on whom she had such anxious designs, or satisfy the appetite and pride of one who had ten thousand a year.
vi: Bà Bennet đã rất muốn giữ họ lại và mời họ ăn tối ngay ngày hôm ấy, nhưng tuy bà luôn chuẩn bị bàn ăn tươm tất, bà nghĩ ít nhất phải có hai món chính để xứng với một người mà bà đã có những ý đồ khao khát, hoặc để thoả mãn tính háo ăn và kiêu hãnh của một người có thu nhập mười nghìn mỗi năm.
tr: Mrs Bennet o gün kalıp onlarla yemek yemelerini teklif etmeyi çok istiyordu ama, sofrası her zaman gayet iyi de olsa, hakkında öyle hevesli planlar kurduğu bir adamı memnun etmeye ya da yılda on bin kazanan bir diğerinin iştahını ve gururunu tatmin etmeye iki menüden aşağısı yetmez diye düşündü.
es: La señora Bennet había estado a punto de invitarles a comer aquel mismo día, pero a pesar de que siempre se comía bien en su casa, no creía que dos platos fuesen de ningún modo suficientes para un hombre que le inspiraba tan ambiciosos proyectos, ni para satisfacer el apetito y el orgullo de otro que tenía diez mil libras al año de renta.
vi_translation: Mrs. Bennet was very eager to keep them and invite them to dinner that very day, but although she always prepared a decent table, she thought there should be at least two main courses to befit a person for whom she had such ardent designs, or to satisfy the appetite and pride of a person with an income of ten thousand a year.
tr_translation: Bennet very much wanted to invite them to stay for dinner that day, but although her table was always quite good, she thought that less than two courses would not be enough to please a man about whom she had such enthusiastic plans or to satisfy the appetite and pride of another who earned ten thousand a year.
es_translation: Mrs. Bennet had been on the verge of inviting them to dine that very day, but despite the fact that one always ate well in her house, she did not believe that two courses would in any way be sufficient for a man who inspired such ambitious projects in her, nor to satisfy the appetite and pride of another who had ten thousand pounds a year in income.

en: “Mrs. Annesley is with her. The others have been gone on to Scarborough these three weeks.”
vi: - Bà Annesley đang ở với cô. Những người khác đã đi Scarborough trong ba tuần này.
tr: "Mrs Annesley yanında. Ötekiler Scarborough'ya gittiler, üç haftalığına.
es: ––Sólo la acompaña la señora Annesley; los demás se han ido a Scarborough a pasar estas tres semanas.
vi_translation: - Mrs. Annesley is staying with her. The others have gone to Scarborough for these three weeks.
tr_translation: "Mrs. Annesley is with her. The others have gone to Scarborough for three weeks."
es_translation: ––Only Mrs. Annesley is accompanying her; the others have gone to Scarborough to spend these three weeks.

en: Elizabeth smiled.
vi: Elizabeth mỉm cười.
tr: Elizabeth gülümsedi.
es: Elizabeth se sonrió.
vi_translation: Elizabeth smiled.
tr_translation: Elizabeth smiled.
es_translation: Elizabeth smiled.

en: He came, and in such very good time, that the ladies were none of them dressed. In ran Mrs. Bennet to her daughters’ room, in her dressing-gown, and with her hair half finished, crying out,—
vi: Anh đến, và đến sớm, đến nỗi các cô chưa kịp ăn vận đàng hoàng. Bà Bennet chạy vào phòng cô con gái, khi bà vẫn còn đang mặc áo khoác ngoài, đầu tóc chỉ bới chải được một nửa.
tr: Geldi; hem de öyle iyi bir zamanda geldi ki hanımların hiçbiri henüz giyinmemişti. Mrs Bennet sabahlığı içinde, saçı yarı yapılmış halde, çığlık çığlığa kızının odasına daldı,
es: Llegó tan temprano que ninguna de las señoras estaba vestida, La señora Bennet corrió al cuarto de sus hijas, en bata y a medio peinar, exclamando:
vi_translation: He arrived, and arrived early, so early that the girls hadn't had time to dress properly. Mrs. Bennet rushed into her daughter's room, while she was still wearing her outer coat, her hair only half done.
tr_translation: He arrived; and he arrived at such a good time that none of the ladies had dressed yet. Mrs. Bennet, in her dressing gown, with her hair half done, burst into her daughter's room, screaming.
es_translation: He arrived so early that none of the ladies were dressed. Mrs. Bennet ran to her daughters' room, in her dressing gown and half-combed, exclaiming:

en: But when her mother was gone, Jane would not be prevailed on to go down without one of her sisters.
vi: Nhưng bà mẹ đã đi xuống, Jane không muốn đi xuống mà không có một trong các em gái xuống cùng.
tr: Ama annesi gittiği zaman Jane yanında kızkardeşlerinden biri olmadan aşağı inmeye yanaşmadı.
es: Pero cuando su madre había salido, Jane no quiso bajar sin alguna de sus hermanas.
vi_translation: But the mother had gone downstairs, Jane did not want to go downstairs without one of her sisters going down with her.
tr_translation: But when her mother left, Jane was unwilling to go downstairs without one of her sisters.
es_translation: But when her mother had gone out, Jane did not want to go downstairs without one of her sisters.

en: Elizabeth was forced to go.
vi: Elizabeth đành phải đi ra.
tr: Elizabeth gitmek zorunda kaldı.
es: Elizabeth no tuvo más remedio que salir.
vi_translation: Elizabeth had to go out.
tr_translation: Elizabeth had to leave.
es_translation: Elizabeth had no choice but to leave.

en: He scarcely needed an invitation to stay supper; and before he went away an engagement was formed, chiefly through his own and Mrs. Bennet’s means, for his coming next morning to shoot with her husband.
vi: Anh không cần được mời ở lại để dùng bữa khuya, trước khi anh ra về, anh và bà Bennet đồng ý với nhau về việc anh sẽ trở lại buổi sáng hôm sau để đi săn với ông chồng bà.
tr: Gece yemeğine kalmak için davet edilmesi bile gerekmedi; gitmeden önce daha çok kendisinin ve Mrs Bennet'ın girişimleriyle ertesi sabah kocasıyla ava çıkmaya gelmesi için sözleşildi.
es: Apenas necesitó que le invitaran para quedarse a cenar y, antes de que se fuera, la señora Bennet le hizo una nueva invitación para que viniese a la mañana siguiente a cazar con su marido.
vi_translation: He did not need to be invited to stay for a late meal; before he left, he and Mrs. Bennet agreed that he would return the next morning to go hunting with her husband.
tr_translation: He didn't even need to be invited to stay for dinner; before leaving, it was agreed, mostly through his and Mrs. Bennet's efforts, that he would come the next morning to go hunting with her husband.
es_translation: He only needed to be invited to stay for dinner, and before he left, Mrs. Bennet extended a new invitation for him to come the next morning to hunt with her husband.

en: Elizabeth, who was left by herself, now smiled at the rapidity and ease with which an affair was finally settled, that had given them so many previous months of suspense and vexation.
vi: Ngồi lại một mình, giờ Elizabeth mỉm cười với cách chuyện tình của hai người đã đi đến hồi an định một cách nhanh chóng và dễ dàng - chuyện tình đã khiến họ căng thẳng và lo âu trong nhiều tháng.
tr: Kendi başına kalan Elizabeth onları o zamana kadar aylarca merak ve gerginlik içinde bırakan meselenin sonunda nasıl hızlı ve kolay halledildiğini düşününce gülümsedi.
es: Elizabeth se quedó sonriendo ante la facilidad y rapidez con que se había resuelto un asunto que había causado tantos meses de incertidumbre y de dolor.
vi_translation: Sitting alone, Elizabeth now smiled at how their love story had quickly and easily reached a settled conclusion - a love story that had caused them tension and anxiety for many months.
tr_translation: Elizabeth, left to herself, smiled as she thought about how quickly and easily the matter that had left them in months of curiosity and tension was finally resolved.
es_translation: Elizabeth stood smiling at the ease and speed with which a matter that had caused so many months of uncertainty and pain had been resolved.

en: “Jane, I congratulate you. You will be a very happy woman.”
vi: - Jane, bố chúc mừng cho con. Con sẽ trở nên một phụ nữ rất hạnh phúc.
tr: "Jane, seni tebrik ederim. Çok mutlu bir kadın olacaksın.
es: ––Te felicito, Jane. Serás una mujer muy feliz.
vi_translation: - Jane, I congratulate you. You will become a very happy woman.
tr_translation: "Jane, I congratulate you. You will be a very happy woman."
es_translation: ––Congratulations, Jane. You will be a very happy woman.

en: Jane went to him instantly, kissed him, and thanked him for his goodness.
vi: Jane đi ngay đến ông, hôn ông, cảm ơn về tình thương của ông.
tr: Jane hemen yanına gidip onu öptü, iyiliği için ona teşekkür etti.
es: Jane corrió hacia su padre, le dio un beso y las gracias por su bondad.
vi_translation: Jane went straight to him, kissed him, and thanked him for his affection.
tr_translation: Jane went right up to him, kissed him, and thanked him for his kindness.
es_translation: Jane ran to her father, gave him a kiss, and thanked him for his kindness.

en: This naturally introduced a panegyric from Jane on his diffidence, and the little value he put on his own good qualities.
vi: Một cách rất tự nhiên, việc này đã khiến Jane cất lời ca ngợi về tính nhút nhát của anh, về việc anh không cố tình phô trương những giá trị tốt của anh.
tr: Bu söz doğal olarak Jane'i Bingley'nin mütevaziliği ve kendi meziyetlerini önemsemeyişi hakkında övgü dolu bir konuşma yapmaya itti.
es: Esto indujo a Jane, naturalmente, a hacer un panegírico de la falta de presunción de su novio y del poco valor que daba a sus propias cualidades.
vi_translation: In a very natural way, this made Jane sing praises about his shyness, about how he did not deliberately flaunt his good qualities.
tr_translation: This remark naturally led Jane to launch into a praise-filled speech about Bingley's modesty and his disregard for his own merits.
es_translation: This naturally led Jane to praise her fiancé's lack of conceit and the little value he placed on his own qualities.

en: Elizabeth replied very concisely that she was.
vi: Elizabeth đáp phải.
tr: Elizabeth kısaca öyle olduğunu söyledi.
es: Elizabeth contestó que sí concisamente.
vi_translation: Elizabeth replied affirmatively.
tr_translation: Elizabeth briefly said that it was so.
es_translation: Elizabeth answered concisely in the affirmative.

en: Mrs. Bennet assured her that they never sat there after dinner; and then added,—
vi: Bà Bennet cho biết gia đình không bao giờ ngồi ở đây sau bữa ăn tối, và thêm:
tr: Mrs Bennet onu akşam yemeğinden sonra orada oturmadıklarına temin etti, sonra ekledi,
es: La señora Bennet le aseguró que nunca estaban allí después de comer, y añadió:
vi_translation: Mrs. Bennet stated that the family never sat here after dinner, and added:
tr_translation: Mrs. Bennet assured them that they did not sit there after dinner, then added,
es_translation: Mrs. Bennet assured her that they were never there after dinner, and added:

en: As soon as they entered the copse, Lady Catherine began in the following manner:—
vi: Ngay khi họ vào khu vườn cây, Phu nhân Catherine bắt đầu:
tr: Ağaçlığa girer girmez Lady Catherine konuşmaya başladı:-
es: Cuando entraron en un breñal, lady Catherine le dijo lo siguiente:
vi_translation: As soon as they entered the orchard, Lady Catherine began:
tr_translation: As soon as they entered the grove, Lady Catherine began to speak:-
es_translation: When they entered a thicket, Lady Catherine said the following to him:

en: “You can be at no loss, Miss Bennet, to understand the reason of my journey hither. Your own heart, your own conscience, must tell you why I come.”
vi: - Cô Bennet, cô có thể dễ dàng hiểu lý do của chuyến đi này của tôi. Tâm tư của cô, lương tri của cô hẳn cho cô biết tại sao tôi đến đây.
tr: "Buraya gelmemin nedenini öğrenince şaşırmazsınız herhalde, Miss Bennet. Kendi kalbiniz, kendi vicdanınız size söylemeli niye geldiğimi.
es: ––Seguramente sabrá usted, señorita Bennet, la razón de mi viaje hasta aquí. Su propio corazón y su conciencia tienen que decirle el motivo de mi visita.
vi_translation: - Miss Bennet, you can easily understand the reason for my visit. Your feelings, your conscience must tell you why I have come here.
tr_translation: "You probably won't be surprised to learn why I came here, Miss Bennet. Your own heart, your own conscience should tell you why I came.""
es_translation: ––Surely you must know, Miss Bennet, the reason for my journey here. Your own heart and conscience must tell you the motive for my visit.

en: “This is not to be borne. Miss Bennet, I insist on being satisfied. Has he, has my nephew, made you an offer of marriage?”
vi: - Việc này không thể chấp nhận được. Cô Bennet, tôi muốn có câu trả lời thỏa đáng. Có phải nó, cháu trai tôi, đã ngỏ lời muốn kết hôn với cô không?
tr: "Dayanılır şey değil. Miss Bennet, cevap almakta ısrar ediyorum. Yeğenim size evlenme teklif etti mi?
es: ––¡Es inaguantable! Señorita Bennet, insisto en que me responda. ¿Le ha hecho mi sobrino proposiciones de matrimonio?
vi_translation: - This is unacceptable. Miss Bennet, I want a satisfactory answer. Did he, my nephew, propose to you?
tr_translation: "It's unbearable. Miss Bennet, I insist on getting an answer. Did my nephew propose to you?"
es_translation: ––It's unbearable! Miss Bennet, I insist that you answer me. Has my nephew proposed to you?

en: “Miss Bennet, do you know who I am? I have not been accustomed to such language as this. I am almost the nearest relation he has in the world, and am entitled to know all his dearest concerns.”
vi: - Cô Bennet, cô có biết tôi là ai không? Tôi không quen nghe thứ ngôn ngữ như thế này. Tôi gần như là người thân thiết nhất của cháu tôi trên thế gian này, tôi có quyền được biết về mọi quan hệ thân thiết nhất của nó.
tr: "Miss Bennet, siz benim kim olduğumu biliyor musunuz? Ben bu tip lisana alışkın değilim. Onun dünyadaki hemen hemen en yakın akrabasıyım ve tüm önemli meselelerini bilmeye yetkiliyim.
es: ––Señorita Bennet, ¿sabe usted quién soy? No estoy acostumbrada a ese lenguaje. Soy casi el familiar más cercano que tiene mi sobrino en el mundo, y tengo motivos para saber cuáles son sus más caros intereses.
vi_translation: - Miss Bennet, do you know who I am? I am not accustomed to hearing such language. I am almost the closest person to my niece in this world, I have the right to know about all her closest relationships.
tr_translation: "Miss Bennet, do you know who I am? I am not accustomed to this kind of language. I am almost the closest relative she has in the world and am entitled to know all her important matters."
es_translation: ––Miss Bennet, do you know who I am? I am not accustomed to that language. I am almost the closest relative my nephew has in the world, and I have reasons to know what his dearest interests are.

en: “Let me be rightly understood. This match, to which you have the presumption to aspire, can never take place. No, never. Mr. Darcy is engaged to my daughter. Now, what have you to say?”
vi: - Tôi cân cho cô hiểu thật rõ về tôi. Cuộc hôn nhân này, mà cô đã táo tợn kỳ vọng, sẽ chẳng bao giờ xảy ra. Không, không bao giờ. Anh Darcy đã hứa hôn với con gái của tôi. Bây giờ, cô muốn nói gì? - Chỉ thế này!
tr: "Doğru anlaşıldığımdan emin olmalıyım. Hayal etme cüreti gösterdiğiniz bu beraberlik asla gerçekleşemez. Hayır, asla. Mr Darcy benim kızımla nişanlı. Hadi bakalım şimdi ne diyeceksiniz?
es: ––Pero no los tiene usted para saber cuáles son los míos, ni el proceder de usted es el más indicado para inducirme a ser más explícita. ––Entiéndame bien: ese matrimonio al que tiene usted la presunción de aspirar nunca podrá realizarse, nunca. El señor Darcy está comprometido con mi hija. ¿Qué tiene usted que decir ahora?
vi_translation: - I want you to understand me very clearly. This marriage, which you have impudently expected, will never happen. No, never. Mr. Darcy is engaged to my daughter. Now, what do you have to say? - Just like this!
tr_translation: "I must ensure that I am understood correctly. The union you dare to imagine can never happen. No, never. Mr. Darcy is engaged to my daughter. Now, let's see what you have to say?"
es_translation: ––But you do not have the right to know what mine are, nor is your behavior the most appropriate to induce me to be more explicit. ––Understand me well: that marriage to which you have the presumption to aspire can never take place, never. Mr. Darcy is engaged to my daughter. What do you have to say now?

en: Lady Catherine hesitated for a moment, and then replied,—
vi: Phu nhân Catherine do dự một chốc, rồi trả lời:
tr: Lady Catherine bir an tereddüt etti, sonra cevap verdi,
es: Lady Catherine vaciló un momento y luego dijo:
vi_translation: Madam Catherine hesitated for a moment, then replied:
tr_translation: Lady Catherine hesitated for a moment, then replied,
es_translation: Lady Catherine hesitated for a moment and then said:

en: “Obstinate, headstrong girl! I am ashamed of you! Is this your gratitude for my attentions to you last spring? Is nothing due to me on that score? Let us sit down. You are to understand, Miss Bennet, that I came here with the determined resolution of carrying my purpose; nor will I be dissuaded from it. I have not been used to submit to any person’s whims. I have not been in the habit of brooking disappointment.”
vi: - Cái đứa con gái ngoan cố, cứng đầu! Tôi lấy làm xấu hổ cho cô! Đây là cách cô trả ơn về những chăm sóc của tôi đối với cô mùa xuân vừa qua, phải không? Cô không cảm thấy còn nợ tôi một chuyện gì đấy hay sao? Ta hãy ngồi xuống. Cô Bennet, cô nên hiểu tôi đến đây với quyết tâm muốn thực hiện mục đích của tôi, không gì có thể lay chuyển được tôi. Tôi không quen chịu phục tùng ý muốn bốc đồng của ai cả. Tôi không có thói quen chịu đựng thất vọng.
tr: "İnatçı, dikbaşlı kız! Senden utanıyorum! Geçen baharda sana gösterdiğim ilgi alakaya böyle mi teşekkür edecektin? O zamandan bana borcun yok mu? "Oturalım. Anlayacaksın, Miss Bennet, buraya amacımı gerçekleştirmeye kararlı olarak geldim; vazgeçmem. Ben ömrümde kimsenin kaprisine boyun eğmedim. Ömrümde hoşgörmedim hayır cevabını.
es: ––¡Ah, criatura tozuda y obstinada! ¡Me da usted vergüenza! ¿Es esa su gratitud por mis atenciones en la pasada primavera? Sentémonos. Ha de saber usted, señorita Bennet, que he venido aquí con la firme resolución de conseguir mi propósito. No me daré por vencida. No estoy acostumbrada a someterme a los caprichos de nadie; no estoy hecha a pasar sinsabores.
vi_translation: - You stubborn, headstrong girl! I am ashamed of you! Is this how you repay the care I gave you last spring? Don't you feel you owe me something? Let's sit down. Miss Bennet, you should understand that I came here with the determination to achieve my goal, and nothing can sway me. I am not accustomed to submitting to anyone's whims. I am not in the habit of enduring disappointment.
tr_translation: "Stubborn, headstrong girl! I am ashamed of you! Is this how you were going to thank me for the attention I showed you last spring? Don't you owe me since then? "Let's sit down. You will understand, Miss Bennet, I came here determined to achieve my purpose; I will not give up. I have never bowed to anyone's whims in my life. I have never tolerated a no as an answer in my life."
es_translation: ––Ah, stubborn and obstinate creature! You make me ashamed! Is that your gratitude for my attentions last spring? Let us sit down. You must know, Miss Bennet, that I have come here with the firm resolution to achieve my purpose. I will not give up. I am not accustomed to submitting to anyone's whims; I am not made to endure disappointments.

en: Lady Catherine seemed pleased.
vi: Phu nhân Catherine có vẻ hài lòng.
tr: Lady Catherine memnun olmuş gibiydi.
es: Lady Catherine parecía complacida.
vi_translation: Mrs. Catherine seemed pleased.
tr_translation: Lady Catherine seemed pleased.
es_translation: Lady Catherine seemed pleased.

en: “Miss Bennet, I am shocked and astonished. I expected to find a more reasonable young woman. But do not deceive yourself into a belief that I will ever recede. I shall not go away till you have given me the assurance I require.”
vi: - Cô Bennet, tôi bị sốc và ngạc nhiên. Tôi đã mong gặp một người con gái biết điều hơn. Nhưng cô đừng ảo vọng tôi sẽ nhượng bộ. Tôi sẽ không ra về nếu cô không bảo đảm với tôi việc tôi yêu cầu.
tr: "Miss Bennet, şok oldum, dehşete düştüm. Daha makul bir genç kadın bulacağımı sanmıştım. Ama vazgeçeceğimi düşünerek kendini aldatma. Bana istediğim garantiyi verene kadar buradan gitmeyeceğim.
es: ¡Señorita Bennet! ¡Estoy horrorizada y sorprendida! Esperaba que fuese usted más sensata. Pero no se haga usted ilusiones: no pienso ceder. No me iré hasta que me haya dado la seguridad que le exijo.
vi_translation: - Miss Bennet, I am shocked and surprised. I had hoped to meet a more sensible young lady. But do not delude yourself that I will yield. I will not leave unless you assure me of what I request.
tr_translation: "Miss Bennet, I am shocked, horrified. I thought I would find a more reasonable young woman. But do not deceive yourself into thinking I will give up. I will not leave here until you give me the guarantee I want."
es_translation: Miss Bennet! I am horrified and astonished! I expected you to be more sensible. But do not delude yourself: I do not intend to yield. I will not leave until you have given me the assurance I demand.

en: “Lady Catherine, I have nothing further to say. You know my sentiments.”
vi: - Phu nhân Catherine, tôi không còn gì để nói thêm. Bà đã hiểu tâm tư của tôi.
tr: "Lady Catherine, söyleyecek başka bir şeyim yok. Düşüncelerimi biliyorsunuz.
es: Lady Catherine, no tengo nada más que decir. Ya sabe cómo pienso.
vi_translation: - Mrs. Catherine, I have nothing more to say. You have understood my feelings.
tr_translation: "Lady Catherine, I have nothing more to say. You know my thoughts."
es_translation: Lady Catherine, I have nothing more to say. You already know what I think.

en: “And this is your real opinion! This is your final resolve! Very well. I shall now know how to act. Do not imagine, Miss Bennet, that your ambition will ever be gratified. I came to try you. I hoped to find you reasonable; but depend upon it I will carry my point.”
vi: - Và ý kiến thật sự của cô là như thế đấy! Đây là chủ định cuối cùng của cô?! Được lắm. Bây giờ tôi biết phải hành động như thế nào. Cô Bennet, đừng tưởng tham vọng của cô sẽ thành hiện thực. Tôi đã đến nhằm cố gắng dàn xếp với cô. Tôi đã hy vọng cô là người biết điều, hầu tôi có thể thuyết phục.
tr: "Gerçek görüşün bu demek! Son kararın bu! Çok güzel. Ben yapacağımı biliyorum. Sanma ki Miss Bennet hırsın mükafatını alacak. Buraya seni denemeye geldim. Seni makul bulacağımı umuyordum; ama şundan emin ol, ben aklıma koyduğumu yaparım.
es: ––¿Y ésta es su actitud, su última resolución? Muy bien; ya sé lo que tengo que hacer. No se figure que su ambición, señorita Bennet, quedará nunca satisfecha. Vine para probarla. Esperaba que fuese usted una persona razonable. Pero tenga usted por seguro que me saldré con la mía.
vi_translation: - And that is her true opinion! This is your final decision?! Very well. Now I know how to act. Miss Bennet, don't think your ambition will come true. I came here to try to settle things with you. I had hoped you were reasonable, so that I could persuade you.
tr_translation: "So this is your true opinion! This is your final decision! Very well. I know what I will do. Do not think that Miss Bennet will reap the rewards of ambition. I came here to test you. I hoped to find you reasonable; but be assured, I will do what I have set my mind to."
es_translation: ––And this is your attitude, your final resolution? Very well; I know what I have to do. Do not imagine that your ambition, Miss Bennet, will ever be satisfied. I came to test you. I hoped you would be a reasonable person. But rest assured that I will have my way.

en: In this manner Lady Catherine talked on till they were at the door of the carriage, when, turning hastily round, she added,—
vi: Trong giọng điệu như thế, phu nhân Catherine tiếp tục nói cho đến khi họ đi đến cỗ xe, rồi thình lình quay lại, bà thêm:
tr: Arabanın kapısına gelene kadar Lady Catherine bu şekilde konuştu durdu; sonra aceleyle dönüp şu sözleri ekledi,
es: Todo esto fue diciendo lady Catherine hasta que llegaron a la puerta del coche. Entonces se volvió y dijo:
vi_translation: In such a tone, Lady Catherine continued to speak until they reached the carriage, then suddenly turning back, she added:
tr_translation: Lady Catherine kept talking like this until they reached the car door; then she turned hastily and added these words,
es_translation: Lady Catherine said all this until they reached the carriage door. Then she turned and said:

en: “I take no leave of you, Miss Bennet. I send no compliments to your mother. You deserve no such attention. I am most seriously displeased.”
vi: - Cô Bennet, tôi không nói lời từ giã với cô. Tôi không muốn gửi lời thăm hỏi đến mẹ cô. Cô không đáng được quan tâm đến như thế. Tôi cảm thấy phật lòng vô cùng.
tr: "Senden izin istemiyorum, Miss Bennet. Annene de selamlarımı göndermiyorum. Böyle bir ilgiyi hak etmiyorsun. Ciddi şekilde canımı sıktın.
es: ––No me despido de usted, señorita Bennet; no mando ningún saludo a su madre; no se merece usted esa atención. Me ha ofendido gravemente.
vi_translation: - Miss Bennet, I am not saying goodbye to you. I do not wish to send my regards to your mother. You do not deserve such attention. I am extremely displeased.
tr_translation: "I am not asking for your permission, Miss Bennet. I am not sending my regards to your mother either. You do not deserve such attention. You have seriously annoyed me."
es_translation: ––I do not bid you farewell, Miss Bennet; I send no regards to your mother; you do not deserve such attention. You have gravely offended me.

en: Elizabeth was forced to give in to a little falsehood here; for to acknowledge the substance of their conversation was impossible.
vi: Elizabeth đành phải nói dối một chút, vì cô không thể nào kể ra nội dung câu chuyện giữa hai người.
tr: Elizabeth bu noktada biraz yalana başvurmak zorunda kaldı; çünkü konuşmalarının konusunu açıklamak imkânsızdı.
es: Elizabeth se vio obligada a contar una pequeña mentira, porque descubrir la materia de su conversación era imposible.
vi_translation: Elizabeth had to tell a little lie because she couldn't possibly reveal the content of the conversation between the two.
tr_translation: Elizabeth had to resort to a bit of lying at this point; because it was impossible to explain the subject of their conversations.
es_translation: Elizabeth was forced to tell a small lie, because uncovering the subject of her conversation was impossible.

en: Elizabeth tried to join in her father’s pleasantry, but could only force one most reluctant smile. Never had his wit been directed in a manner so little agreeable to her.
vi: Elizabeth muốn phụ họa với câu pha trò của ông bố, nhưng chỉ có thể gượng gạo nở một nụ cười. Chưa bao giờ cách bông đùa của ông làm trở nên kém dễ chịu đối với cô như thế này. Ông hỏi:
tr: Elizabeth babasının eğlencesine katılmak istedi, ama sadece çok keyifsiz bir biçimde gülümsemeyi başarabildi. Babasının alaycılığı ona hiç o kadar sevimsiz görünmemişti.
es: Elizabeth trató de bromear con su padre, pero su esfuerzo no llegó más que a una sonrisa muy tímida. El humor de su padre no había tomado nunca un derrotero más desagradable para ella.
vi_translation: Elizabeth wanted to chime in with her father's joke, but could only manage a forced smile. Never before had his manner of joking become so unpleasant to her as it was now. He asked:
tr_translation: Elizabeth wanted to join in her father's amusement, but she could only manage a very joyless smile. Her father's sarcasm had never seemed so unpleasant to her.
es_translation: Elizabeth tried to joke with her father, but her effort resulted in nothing more than a very timid smile. Her father's mood had never taken a more unpleasant turn for her.

en: “Oh,” cried Elizabeth, “I am exceedingly diverted. But it is so strange!”
vi: Elizabeth thốt lên: - Ôi! Con đã bị phân tâm quá mức. Những việc này thật là lạ lùng. - Đúng.
tr: "Yo," diye haykırdı Elizabeth, "son derece eğlendim. Ama çok tuhaf.
es: ––Sí, me he divertido mucho ––exclamó Elizabeth––. ¡Pero es tan extraño!
vi_translation: Elizabeth exclaimed: - Oh! I have been overly distracted. These things are really strange. - Right.
tr_translation: "Yo," shouted Elizabeth, "I had a great time. But it's very strange."
es_translation: ––Yes, I had a lot of fun ––exclaimed Elizabeth––. But it is so strange!

en: “Mr. Darcy, I am a very selfish creature, and for the sake of giving relief to my own feelings care not how much I may be wounding yours. I can no longer help thanking you for your unexampled kindness to my poor sister. Ever since I have known it I have been most anxious to acknowledge to you how gratefully I feel it. Were it known to the rest of my family I should not have merely my own gratitude to express.”
vi: - Anh Darcy, tôi là người rất ích kỷ, và trong khi tôi cố tạo khuây khỏa cho tâm tư tôi, tôi không để tâm đến việc tôi có thể gây tổn thương cho tâm tư anh ra sao. Tôi không còn có thể tránh né việc cám ơn anh về lòng tốt không gì sánh được đối với đứa em khốn khổ của tôi. Từ lúc tôi biết được việc này, tôi luôn khoắc khoải tìm cách nói cho anh rõ tôi cảm thấy trân trọng biết ơn anh đến dường nào. Nếu những người còn lại trong gia đình tôi được biết, tôi đã không chỉ nói ra về lòng tri ân của riêng tôi.
tr: "Mr Darcy, ben çok bencil bir yaratığım; kendi duygularımı rahatlatmak uğruna sizinkileri ne kadar rahatsız ettiğime aldırmam. Artık kendimi tutamıyorum; zavallı kızkardeşime yaptığınız benzersiz iyilik için size teşekkür ederim. Öğrendiğimden beri bunu ne kadar minnettarlıkla hissettiğimi size söylemek için sabırsızlanıyorum. Ailemin diğer üyeleri bilselerdi, sadece kendi minnettarlığımı ifade etmekle kalmazdım.
es: ––Señor Darcy, soy una criatura muy egoísta que no me preocupo más que de mis propios sentimientos, sin pensar que quizá lastimaría los suyos. Pero ya no puedo pasar más tiempo sin darle a usted las gracias por su bondad sin igual para con mi pobre hermana. Desde que lo supe he estado ansiando manifestarle mi gratitud. Si mi familia lo supiera, ellos también lo habrían hecho.
vi_translation: - Mr. Darcy, I am a very selfish person, and while I tried to ease my own mind, I did not consider how I might hurt yours. I can no longer avoid thanking you for the unparalleled kindness you have shown to my wretched sister. Since I learned of this, I have been anxiously seeking a way to express to you how deeply grateful I am. If the rest of my family knew, I would not be speaking only of my own gratitude.
tr_translation: "Mr. Darcy, I am a very selfish creature; I do not care how much I trouble you in order to ease my own feelings. I can no longer restrain myself; thank you for the unparalleled kindness you have shown to my poor sister. Since I learned of it, I have been eager to tell you how grateful I feel. If the other members of my family knew, I would not only express my own gratitude."
es_translation: ––Mr. Darcy, I am a very selfish creature who cares only for my own feelings, without thinking that I might hurt yours. But I can no longer go on without thanking you for your unparalleled kindness towards my poor sister. Since I found out, I have been longing to express my gratitude to you. If my family knew, they would have done so as well.

en: Elizabeth was too much embarrassed to say a word. After a short pause, her companion added, “You are too generous to trifle with me. If your feelings are still what they were last April, tell me so at once. My affections and wishes are unchanged; but one word from you will silence me on this subject for ever.”
vi: Elizabeth quá lúng túng nên không thốt lên được lời nào. Im lặng một chốc, anh thêm: - Cô có tâm tình khoáng đạt nên tôi tin cô sẽ không đùa cợt với tôi. Nếu tâm tư của cô vẫn còn như lúc tháng Tư vừa rồi, cô cứ nói ngay cho tôi biết như thế. Những tình cảm và ước nguyện của tôi vẫn không thay đổi, nhưng chỉ cần một tiếng nói của cô là tôi sẽ không bao giờ đề cập đến chuyện này nữa.
tr: Elizabeth tek kelime edemeyecek kadar utanmıştı. Kısa bir sessizlikten sonra yol arkadaşı sözlerine devam etti, "Benimle oyun oynamayacak kadar naziksiniz. Eğer duygularınız hâlâ geçen Nisan'daki gibiyse, bana bunu hemen söyleyin. Benim duygu ve dileklerim değişmedi, ama tek bir sözünüz beni bu konuda ilelebet susturacaktır.
es: Elizabeth estaba tan confusa que no podía hablar. Después de una corta pausa, su compañero añadió: ––Es usted demasiado generosa para burlarse de mí. Si sus sentimientos son aún los mismos que en el pasado abril, dígamelo de una vez. Mi cariño y mis deseos no han cambiado, pero con una sola palabra suya no volveré a insistir más.
vi_translation: Elizabeth was too embarrassed to say a word. After a moment of silence, he added: - You have an open-hearted disposition, so I trust you won't make fun of me.
